title: kawakaze_(azur_lane)
body:
Ninth ship of the Shiratsuyu-class destroyers, IJN [i]Kawakaze[/i] (æ±Ÿé¢¨), as she appears in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i].

Kawakaze in story serves as the bodyguard for [[Nagato (azur lane)|Nagato]]. Her demeanor is typically much colder in comparison to her sisters, likely as a result of such a serious duty.

As she was designed by [[Nagishiro Mito]], she [[creator_connection|bears a striking resemblance]] to [[Shirakami Fubuki]], seemingly [[look-alike]]s (they are both variants to the artist's monochrome-style [[fox girl]] design). While it has been pointed out long ago, it came even further to light when the latter became available in the game via a collaboration event in December 2019, Fubuki even having a line pointing this out.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]], as well as [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]] that both have accents of black. Her outfit consists of black and white kimono, that also possesses a [[sailor collar]] and [[blue ribbon]] similar to a serafuku. She wears a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], black [[thighhighs]] and heels that appear to be made out of metal plates. She also possesses several straight black [[katana|katanas]].

Her outfit is a [[Y2K fashion|Y2K]]-styled [[baggy clothes|baggy]] look inspired by R&B singer "Aaliyah":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aaliyah] and comprised of a [[red jacket|red]] [[letterman jacket]], [[blue pants|blue]] [[jeans]], [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]], an [[American flag print]] [[tube top]], and a [[white headband]].

title: tirpitz_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Tirpitz[/i]. Character design by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Tanaka Atsuko]].

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit is a white [[military uniform]], [[white headwear|white]] [[peaked cap]], [[white gloves]], [[cross earrings]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]] with a [[German flag print]] on her left side, and [[white boots|white]] [[fur-trimmed boots|fur-trimmed]] [[thigh boots]]. She is also shown holding a red Nordic cross [[flag]], a reference to her historical stint as a one-ship "fleet in being" in Norway.

Her [[rigging]] consists of four interconnected hull pieces, each with a 380 mm twin gun mount and held by her bridge structure to her back. Two 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] are also mounted.

title: gensou_suikoden_ii
body:
The second game in the [i][[Gensou Suikoden]][/i] series, which takes place three years after the first game. It takes place in Dunan, immediately northwest of the Scarlet Moon Empire/Toran Republic of the first game, and follows the story of [[Riou (suikoden)|]] and [[Jowy Atreides-Blight|Jowy Atreides]], who become hosts of the two halves of the Rune of the Beginning and leaders in the war between the Jowston Alliance and Highland Kingdom. Numerous characters from the first game play major roles, resulting in [i]Gensou Suikoden II[/i] introducing the fewest new characters of any game in the main series.

[i][[Gensou Suikogaiden]][/i] is a side story to [i]Gensou Suikoden II[/i], overlapping considerably with its story.

title: gensou_suikoden
body:
An RPG series by [[Konami]] which revolves around the concept of the "108 Stars of Destiny" (108 recruitable characters, all of whom must be found and kept alive to get the best endings) and "27 True Runes" (magical items that grant immense magical power and immortality to their human hosts, usually with rather unpleasant side effects). So far there are five main games and three spinoffs, along with novelizations and manga adaptations of the main five.

It is loosely based on the Chinese novel [[Water Margin]] ([i]Water Margin[/i]).

h4. Games

title: alice_(alice_in_wonderland)
body:
The main character of [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]. A curious little girl who ends up on an unplanned adventure when she falls down a rabbit hole. Throughout the story she is in search of the [[White Rabbit (alice In Wonderland)|]].

Alice is popularly depicted wearing a pale blue knee-length dress with a white [[apron|pinafore]] overtop. Her hair is held back with a wide ribbon.

Since many early illustrations were black and white, her colors would vary from artist to artist; it was [[Disney]] who made blue the most popular color for her dress [[blue eyes|her eyes]] and [[blonde hair|blonde]] for her hair. Completing the signature appearance are white [[pantyhose]], [[bloomers]] and a black [[hairband]].

Disney's depiction of Alice is so popular that in subsequent media, it is common for a character named "Alice" to share the aforementioned traits from Disney's Alice (especially her costumes as well as her hair and eye color), even if that said character has nothing to do with Alice in Wonderland itself.

h4. See also

* [[Alice (alice in wonderland) (cosplay)|Alice (Cosplay)]]

title: pear-shaped_figure
body:
A female body type commonly seen on [[petite]] and [[shortstack]] characters, with [[wide hips|hips wider than their bust]], resembling the shape of a pear. Sometimes also called a triangle body type. Usually a package deal with [[narrow waist]] and [[thick thighs]]. Most often also paired with a [[flat chest]] or [[small breasts]] for further accentuation through contrast, though this is not required so long as the hips are noticeably wider than the bust.

If the width of the bust and hips are about equal, it's likely a [[curvy|hourglass]] figure, not a pear.

h4. Examples

* !post #8236970
* !post #5364479

title: lewis_carroll
body: Charles Lutwidge Dodgson (/ËˆlÊŒtwÉªdÊ’ ËˆdÉ’dsÉ™n/ LUT-wij DOD-sÉ™n; 27 January 1832 â€“ 14 January 1898), better known by his pen name Lewis Carroll, was an English author, poet, mathematician, photographer and reluctant Anglican deacon. His most notable works are [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]] (1865) and its sequel Through the Looking-Glass (1871). He was noted for his facility with word play, logic, and fantasy. His poems Jabberwocky (1871) and The Hunting of the Snark (1876) are classified in the genre of literary nonsense. Some of Alice's nonsensical wonderland logic reflects his published work on mathematical logic.

title: hookah
body:
A single or multi-stemmed (often glass-based) water pipe for [[smoking]]. Originated from India. Operates by water filtration and indirect heat. It can be used for smoking herbal fruits, tobacco, or even marijuana.

The [[caterpillar]] from Lewis Carroll's book [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]], is illustrated smoking one of these.

title: alice_(black_souls)
body:
Major character in [[Black Souls]] and Black Souls 2. Based on [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]].

Can appear as several variations including Daughter Alice, Little Sister Alice, and Mother Alice in Black Souls 2.

[spoilers]
She's modeled after the real [[Alice Liddell (black souls)|]], who was into a relationship with Lewis Carroll until her father exiled the latter. Years later, Carroll became disgusted upon finding Alice's youthful beauty was gone and wished to go back to the old days, resulting in him being spirited away by Mary Sue and becoming Grimm.

Alice is a role played by The Crawling One a.k.a. [[Nyarlathotep]].
[[Daughter Alice (black souls)|]] is a role played by [[Bandersnatch (black souls)|]]
[[Sister Alice (black souls)|]] is a role played by [[JubJub (black souls)|]]

body:

In terms of character design, she is inspired by [[Alice (Alice in Wonderland)|]] from [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]], even sharing the same name.

title: alice_(alice_in_wonderland)_(cosplay)
body:
Characters from known series who [[cosplay|dress]] as [[Alice (alice in wonderland)|Alice]] from [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]. The most common influence is the signature [[Alice (Disney)|Disney]] version: [[blonde hair|blonde-haired]] with [[hairband]], [[blue dress]] with [[apron]], [[bloomers]], [[white pantyhose]] and [[mary janes]].

title: cheshire_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] heavy cruiser HMS [i]Cheshire[/i], as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. Character design by [[yyy (zelda10010)|]], voiced by [[Ishigami Shizuka]].

Her appearance is meant to invoke the image of the [[Cheshire Cat (alice in wonderland)|]] from [[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]], with her [[maid headdress]] resembling [[cat ears]] and a near-constant [[:3]] expression on her face. Physically, Chesire has dark [[grey hair]] with blue highlights, and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit, like many of the other Royal Maids, [[large breasts|emphasizes her bust]].

Cheshire is an amorous woman who frequently refers to the [[Commander (azur lane)|]] as "Darling", and claims to have imprinted upon them as a result of being built. She also has an interest in cats, as well as Sakura Empire ships that sport cat ears such as [[Yamashiro (azur lane)|]] and [[Akashi (azur lane)|]].

h4. Skins

* !post #4002141: Default
* !post #9395987: [[Cheshire_(White_Seaside_Melody)_(Azur_Lane)|White Seaside Melody]] (Wedding dress)

body:

title: voltron_(series)
body:
A United States dub and combination of two unrelated science fiction anime - [i][[Hyakujuu-ou GoLion]][/i] and [i][[Kikou Kantai Dairugger XV]][/i] -  that originally ran from 1983 to 1985, produced by World Events Productions. World Events Productions created original western-produced installments in the franchise, and later acquired the rights to both of the original Japanese series used to create the first Voltron.

It stars the titular [[mecha]] [b]Voltron[/b], the name being used to refer to the titular mechas of the original series Voltron is based on, [[GoLion (mecha)|]] ([[Lion Voltron]]) and [[Dairugger XV (mecha)|]] ([b]Vehicle Voltron[/b]).

h4. Works in the [i]Voltron[/i] series

* [i]Voltron: Defender of the Universe[/i]
** [i][[Hyakujuu-ou GoLion|Voltron III, of the Far Universe]][/i] (Lion Force)
** [i][[Kikou Kantai Dairugger XV|Voltron I, of the Near Universe]][/i] (Vehicle Force)
** [i]Voltron: Fleet of Doom[/i]
* [i]Voltron: The Third Dimension[/i]
* [i][[Voltron Force]][/i]
* [i][[Voltron: Legendary Defender]][/i]

h4. See also

* [[Kousoku Denjin Albegas]]
* [[Mirai Robo Daltanious]]

title: dairugger_xv_(mecha)
body:
ãƒ€ã‚¤ãƒ©ã‚¬ãƒ¼XV (Dairugger Fifteen)

The titular [[gattai]] [[mecha]] from the [[Kikou Kantai Dairugger XV]] anime series.

The heroic anime [[super robot]] consists of the largest number of separate [[mecha|mechas]] ([[Rugger 1]] ~ [[Rugger 15]]). (Some "evil":http://wiki.cre.jp/SRW/%E3%82%B4%E3%83%83%E3%83%89%E3%83%8D%E3%83%AD%E3%82%B9 or parody combined robots from other anime series have many more constitutive units).

Like so many other 70s~80s super robots, it was designed by industrial designer  "Murakami Katsushi.":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?id=9769

In [[Voltron (series)|]], it also became known as Voltron, but is commonly referred to as [b]Vehicle Voltron[/b] by fans. It has made much fewer return appearances compared to [[Lion Voltron]].

body:

The [[super robot]] consists of five female lion-shaped robots. In the story GoLion has a mythical origin and nobody knows who built it. Its main weapon is a sword called åç‹å‰£ ([i]Juuou-ken[/i]).

h4. See also

* [[Lion Voltron]]

title: houquet_et_rose
body:
One of the main characters from the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] science fiction [[mecha]] anime series.

[b]Houquet Et Rose[/b] is an attractive, if grumpy, 16-year-old former [[motorcycle]] gang member who becomes part of [[Stick Bernard]]'s band of human rebels fighting against the [[Inbit]] [[alien]] invaders. She is probably the most skilled biker in the squad. 

Houquet's mecha of choice is a red [i]VR-038L Bartley[/i] [[mospeada_(mecha)|Mospeada]], but she is a fast learner, becoming a skilled pilot after Stick teaches her how to use a red [[Legioss]] too. 

Her name was changed to [b]Rook Bartley[/b] in the [[Robotech]] American adaptation of the series.

title: 7_days_to_die
body:
[b]7 Days to Die[/b] is an open world survival horror video game set in a [[post-apocalypse|post-apocalyptic]] world populated by [[zombie|zombies]]. It is developed by the Fun Pimps.

h4. External links

* "Official website":[https://7daystodie.com/]
* "Wikipedia: 7 Days to Die":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/7_Days_to_Die]

title: millia_jenius
body:
A fictional female humanoid [[alien]] character from the [[MACROSS]] franchise that first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982. She also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie adaptation, the [[Macross 7]] TV series and the [[Macross M3]] [[video game]].

[b]Millia Fallyna[/b] is a very skilled and dangerous, female [[Zentradi]] ([[Meltrandi]]) [[Quimeliquola]] [[Queadluun-Rau]] [[power armor]] ace pilot. Her nemesis is [[U.N. Spacy]] [[VF-1]] ace [[Maximilian Jenius]]. [spoilers]She is defeated in combat by Jenius, so she becomes a [[miclone]] spy and infiltrates the [[SDF-1]], intent on finding and killing the human pilot who defeated her several times. However, after confronting Max again and being spared by him she finally realizes her feelings of Max were not actually hatred, but love. After a brief time she marries Max, thus she adopts his second name and becomes [b]Millia Jenius[/b]. Then she joins the U.N. Spacy and becomes a VF-1 ace pilot herself.[/spoilers]

In the [i]Do You Remember Love[/i] anime film her name was changed to [b]Millia 639[/b] and in the [[Robotech]] western adaptation to [b]Miriya Parina Sterling[/b].

h4. See also

* [[Maximilian Jenius]]
* [[Komillia Maria Jenius]]
* [[Mylene Jenius]]
* [[Emilia Jenius]]
* [[Mirage Farina Jenius]]

* [[Jeanne Francaix]]

title: jeanne_francaix
body:
A fictional female main character from [[choujikuu_kidan_southern_cross|The Super Dimension Cavalry Southern Cross]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 80s.

[b]Jeanne Francaix[/b] is a [[blonde hair]]ed member of the [[ATAC]] ([i]Alpha Tactics Armored Corps[/i]) 15th squadron, a mechanized infantry unit used in the defense of the human colony at [[planet Glorie]].

Her [[mecha]] of choice is the ATAC [[Spartas]].

She can be a very jovial, funny, cheerful and childish character during peacetime, but also a serious capable leader and an intrepid, brave warrior during combat.

In the original series her name and character were inspired by those of legendary [[france|French]] heroine [[jeanne_d'arc|Joan of Arc]].

In the adapted, English-language [[ROBOTECH]] anime for North American audiences, this character was renamed [b]Dana Sterling[/b].

In that continuity she is the daughter of human ace pilot [[maximilian_jenius|Max Sterling]] and [[zentradi|Zentraedi]] ace pilot [[millia_jenius|Miriya Parina Sterling]].

A capable mecha driver herself, she carries the same character traits as Jeanne Francaix, and fights for the Earth Armies of the Southern Cross, in the Second Robotech War.

Her [[mecha]] of choice is the Southern Cross [[spartas|Veritech Hovertank]].

title: aisha_(mospeada)
body:
[b]Aisha[/b] (ã‚¢ã‚¤ã‚·ãƒ£) is a female character from the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 80s.

She is [spoiler]an [[Inbit]] [[alien]] in female humanoid form.[/spoiler]

Aisha was given the name [b]Ariel[/b]/[b]Marlene[/b] in the [[Robotech]] American adaptation, not to be confused with another Mospeada character named Marlene, otherwise known as Marlene Rush in Robotech.

title: class_card_(prisma_illya)
body:
Magical artifacts created to allow for the summoning of heroic spirits similar to Servants that instead allows the user to borrow their powers & abilities. They serve as a major plot point in [[Fate/kaleid liner Prisma Illya]].

They have two main functions, [b]Include[/b] and [b]Install[/b]. Inclusion allows for the wielder to materialize a weapon or Noble Phantasm belonging to the heroic spirit, while installing manifests the servant directly into the user's body, including their [[cosplay|appearance]].

The cards can also manifest independently as blackened Servants, acting as weaker versions of their own selves.

h4. Known Cards & Users
* [[Artoria Pendragon (Fate)|Saber]]: [[Zachary Ainsworth]], [[Miyu Edelfelt (Saber Install)|]], [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Saber Install)|]]
* [[Gilgamesh (Fate)|Archer]]: [[Angelica Ainsworth (Archer Install)|]], [[Miyu Edelfelt (Archer Install)|]]
* [[Archer (Fate)|Nameless Archer]]: [[Emiya Shirou (Archer Install) (Prisma Illya)|Emiya Shirou]], [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Archer Install)|]], [[Chloe von Einzbern (Archer Install)|]]
* [[Cu Chulainn (Fate/Stay Night)|Lancer]]: [[Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald]], [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Lancer Install)|]]
* [[Medusa (Rider) (Fate)|Rider]]: [[Matou Kariya (Rider Install)|]], [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Rider Install)|]], [[Miyu Edelfelt (Rider Install)|]]
* [[Medea (caster) (fate)|Caster]]: [[Atram Galiast]], [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Caster Install)|]]
* Assassin: [[Matou Shinji]], [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Assassin Install)|]], [[Miyu Edelfelt (Assassin Install)|]]
* [[Heracles (Fate)|Berserker]]: [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Berserker Install)|]], [[Miyu Edelfelt (Berserker Install)|]]

title: ichijou_hikaru
body:
One of the main protagonists of [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series, the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie adaptation and the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA.

[b]Ichijo Hikaru[/b] is a young [[fan racer]] civilian [[aircraft]] [[pilot]] who becomes an atypical mecha anime [[science fiction]] hero in the [[Macross]] series. 

Despite some early personality clashes with other characters and some family tragedies from his past, he is a rather humble, intelligent, optimistic and jovial person, in contrast to the usually hot-headed, reckless and grim type of heroes from other [[mecha]] series. 

Hikaru is of Japanese ethnicity and also [[Roy Focker]]'s best friend. Hikaru's mecha of choice are the [[VF-1J]], the [[VF-1J Armored]], the [[VF-1S]], the [[VF-1 Super]], the [[VF-1 Strike]] (DYRL) and the [[VF-4]] (Flashback 2012).

In the [[Robotech]] western cartoon adaptation his name was changed to [b]Rick Hunter[/b] and his ethnicity to American.

h4. See also

* [[Hayase Misa]]
* [[Lynn Minmay]]

h4.External link

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hikaru_Ichijyo

title: robotech
body:
The North American adaptation/westernification of [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|Super Dimension Fortress Macross]], [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross|Super Dimension Cavalry Southern Cross]], and [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada|Genesis Climber Mospeada]] -- actually an edited amalgamation of the three original (and unrelated) Japanese anime series, with their plots significantly altered to appear as though they comprise a single continuous storyline. 

The ROBOTECH adaptation also featured modified dialogue and different music (by "Ulpio Minucci":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulpio_Minucci]), which was developed by an American company called [[Harmony Gold]] and producer and story editor "Carl Macek":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Macek]. It was first syndicated to American TV stations in 1985 and a few years later in several other countries across the world. It was quite popular during its first time of release in the West, as many anime fans of that era thought it was made of original content (which it wasn't).

Historically, [b]ROBOTECH has been an extremely polarizing subject amongst [[otaku|anime fans]], and it remains controversial even to this day[/b].

Many critics look down upon the show for its extensive edits to the source material (Westernizing character names, editing for content, forging a connection between previously-unrelated series, and so on), to the extent that some of its most ardent detractors compare it to the Woody Allen film "[i]What's Up, Tiger Lily?[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What%27s_Up,_Tiger_Lily%3F, a Japanese spy thriller completely redubbed and re-edited to become a campy musical comedy.  

On the other hand, the series does have its staunch defenders as well, most of whom will cite the fact that the adaptation had a new original epic and memorable music soundtrack and that it served as an important "gateway" to anime (particularly the [[mecha]] genre) for many Americans (and other Westerners) who grew up in the [[1980s (style)|80s]]. 

After several legal disputes over the international rights of the original series ([[MACROSS]] mostly) a settlement was reached between the parties in 2021 and now both the original and adapted series will be freely available everywhere in the world, allowing western anime fans to know more about the original franchises and the Japanese to watch the adaptation and purchase their respective merchandise without any legal constrains for the first time.

This tag should be used sparingly, and [i]only[/i] on pictures that are clearly intended to depict or reflect the ROBOTECH version of events. Otherwise, the tags for the original three series should instead be used:

* [b]The Macross Saga[/b]: [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]]
* [b]The Masters Saga[/b]: [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]]
* [b]The New Generation[/b]: [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]]

Also note that the American-produced anime film [[The Shadow Chronicles]] is considered part of the ROBOTECH universe, but not that of any of the original Japanese series.

h4. See also

* [[Ichijou Hikaru]]
* [[Hayase Misa]]
* [[Jeanne Francaix]]
* [[Houquet Et Rose]]

* [[Itano circus]]

* [[Robotech: Love Live Alive]]

* [[Robotech: The Motion Picture]]

* [[Robotech: Force of Arms]]

title: maximilian_jenius
body:
One of the characters of the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series, the [[Macross 7]] TV series, the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] and the [[Macross Delta: Zettai Live!!!!!!]] movie adaptations, the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA and the [[Macross M3]] [[video game]]. 

[b]Max Jenius[/b] was born in Europe. He is a young fighter pilot, having joined [[Ichijou Hikaru]]'s Vermillion Team, along with [[Kakizaki Hayao]], at the age of only 16. 

Jenius shows in his first sortie that he is a preternaturally talented ace pilot who is near invincible in combat, despite his need to wear corrective lenses on duty. He is quickly recognized as the top pilot of the force, as marked by being granted to distinctively repaint his mecha into his preferred blue color.

His [[mecha]] of choice are the [[VF-1]] (and its [[VF-1A]], [[VF-1J]] and [[VF-1S]] variants), the [[VF-3000]], [[VF-4]], [[VF-9]], [[VF-11]], [[VF-14]], [[VF-22]] and the [[YF-29]]. All are painted in his favorite blue and white color scheme.

In the [[Robotech]] western cartoon adaptation his name was changed to [b]Maximilian Sterling[/b] and his ethnicity to American.

title: jojifuku
body:
Adults (that is - people outside the intended demographic) wearing nostalgic young children's clothing such as [[kindergarten uniform]]s, [[randoseru]], and brands such as [[Mezzo Piano]]. Usually considered to be a subcategory of the [[heisei retro]] style. Derived from the hashtag "å¤§äººãªã®ã«å¥³å…æœç€ã¦ã‚‹" (otonananoni jojifuku ki teru) - "even though I'm an adult, I'm wearing girls' clothes".

This term is sometimes also used to refer to the heisei retro style in general outside of Danbooru, but this tag is for older people wearing children's clothes, and should not be used on pictures of children such as post #8895336 - these can be tagged as just [[heisei retro]].

title: color_timer
body:
A [[light bulb]]-like instrument usually attached on an [[Ultra Series|Ultraman]]'s chest. Emitting a steady, blue light at full power, it blinks red if an Ultraman is running out of power or if he is approaching to his time limit. If the Color Timer stops emitting light, it signals either the death of an Ultraman or he'll simply reverts back to his human form. It is also known as the "[b]Warning Light[/b]" in the English dub.

Its name differs, depending on which universe, for example; in [[Ultraman Gaia|Gaia]]'s world, it's known as the [b]Life Gauge[/b], or in [[Ultraman Nexus|Nexus]]' world, it's the [b]Energy Core[/b]. And the U40 Ultras instead obtain a similar item known as the [b]Star Symbols[/b].

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Color Timer":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Color_Timer]

title: gold_cloth
body:
The highest rank of Cloth in [[Saint Seiya]] adorning the [[gold_saint|Gold Saints]].

As their name suggests, they are [[gold armor|golden sets of armor]] that provide the most coverage compared to their Bronze and Silver counterparts.
They number 12 in total, each is based on one of the twelve zodiac constellations.

In [[saint_seiya:_next_dimension|Next Dimension]]; [Spoiler]it is revealed there was a 13th gold cloth during the age of myth, based on the Ophiuchus constellation.

body:
Folktale about a [[rabbit]] on the [[moon]] pounding [[mochi]].

In Japanese culture, instead of seeing "the man on the moon" it is said that there is a rabbit pounding [[mochi]]. In Chinese folktale, "Jade rabbit" makes the elixir of immortality on the moon.

title: c-23
body:
Although looking extremely similar to [[C-22]], C-23 has more motivation than the older humanoid and is viewed as 'closer to a human' with her personality, this might be because she possesses an advanced, self-aware AI. She is sent on a mission as the M.R.S (Machine manufacture Research and development System) believes that there has been something strange going with the dimensions and the sudden disappearance of many weapons. She steers the final unit, SMD-31-FX "Gesshoku".

https://touhou.fandom.com/wiki/C-23

title: person-shaped_hole
body: A [[hole]] shaped like a person's outline, formed by either falling from a great height or smashing through a wall. This trope is associated with Western animation.

title: pith_helmet
body:
A lightweight cloth-covered helmet made of cork or pith. Designed to shade the wearer's head and face from the sun, pith helmets were often worn by people of European origin in the tropics, but have also been used in other contexts. The gear is seen as typical explorer's headwear, and thus will be associated with those exploring wilderness (such as a safari) or going on expeditions.

h4. See Also

title: jar_jar_binks
body:
Jar Jar Binks is a fictional character of the Gungan race from the [[Star Wars]] saga created by [[George Lucas]]. Jar Jar appears throughout the Star Wars prequel trilogy â€“ as a major character in [[star wars: The Phantom Menace|Episode I: The Phantom Menace]], with a smaller role in [[star wars: Attack of the Clones|Episode II: Attack of the Clones]], and with only a one-line cameo in  [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith|Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]].â€“ as well as having a role in the television series [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]]. The first fully computer-generated supporting character in a live-action film, he has been voiced by Ahmed Best in most of his appearances, who also acted out the character with prosthetics prior to the CGI work.

He was met with overwhelming dislike from both audiences and critics, and has been recognized as one of the most hated characters in Star Wars and the history of film in general, but the character's reception has changed as he has been championed by fans who had seen the prequels at the time of their release as children. He has also been defended by members of the prequels' production team.

title: gewehr_43
body:
The Gewehr 43 is a 7.92Ã—57mm Mauser semi-automatic [[rifle]] developed by [[Nazi]] Germany during [[World War II]]. It was a modification of the earlier [[Gewehr 41]], using an improved gas system similar to that of the [[Soviet]] [[SVT-40]]. Feed system is 10-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. Over 400,000 units were produced between 1943-1945.

h1. See also
* [[G43 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Gewehr 43":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gewehr_43

title: animal_head
body:
A humanoid body with an creatureâ€™s (insect, bear, sea slug, etc.) head in place of an expected humanoid head. Very commonly depicted in many mythological creatures and gods across cultures.

The opposite (a human head on an animal body) is [[human head]].

Only tag this as [[furry]] if the rest of the character's body exhibits similar animalistic traits such as [[body fur]] or [[colored skin]].

* [[animal on head]]
* [[object head]]

title: ox_guard
body:
A [[fighting stance]] where a character holds a sword at the side of their face/head [[two-handed|with both hands]] (or less commonly one hand, with the other close to the hilt). This versatile stance allows them to attack or defend, depending on the incoming blow.

Depictions commonly include the [[sword_in_front_of_face|blade in front of the character's face]], and one arm crossing over the body.

The stance has names in several different languages. In German, it is known as the [i]ochs[/i] (ox) guard; in Italian, [i]posta de fenestra[/i] (window guard); in Japanese, [i]kasumi no kamae[/i] (mist stance).

h4. Examples

* !post #8504226
* !post #5607428
* !post #6226918

h4. See also

title: mifune_shioriko
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Elected student council president of Nijigasaki, succeeding [[Yuki Setsuna]]. 

Her personality varies greatly between [[love live! school idol festival all stars|ALL STARS]] and the anime. In ALL STARS, she is very heavy-handed at first, practically ousting Setsuna out of the position of student council president. In the anime, she is much more neutral, helping out with club activities at first. In both cases, her motivation stems from her older sister, [[Mifune Kaoruko]], who was once a school idol.

She has [[red eyes|red]] or [[orange eyes|orange eyes]], and a [[short hair|short]] to [[medium hair|medium]] [[green hair|green]]-[[black hair|black]] [[bob cut]] with [[swept bangs]] and a small [[hair ribbon]] on the side. She typically has a clearly defined [[fang]]. As the student council president, sometimes she wears a red [[armband]].

She is a member of [[R3BIRTH (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Koizumi Moeka]].

title: slingshot_swimsuit
body:
A slingshot swimsuit, also known as a sling bikini or mankini for males, is a type of [[swimsuit]] that stretches from the crotch, separates to cover the nipples, up over the shoulders and across the back. It can be best described as a [[thong]] that goes over the shoulders, providing minimal coverage to the wearer. Such a swimsuit can be described a having a V-front, although swimsuits that seem to be like X-top bikinis from the front with no clear indication as a bikini otherwise from the side have been described here in Danbooru as also slingshots. 

A common gag is that the [[areola slip|straps fail to completely]] [[nipple slip|cover the nipples]].

While slingshot swimsuits are technically [[one-piece swimsuit|one-piece swimsuits]], they are considered to be in their own category and should not be tagged as one-piece swimsuits.

h4. See also

* [[slingshot tan]]
* [[sling bikini top]]
* [[pretzel bikini]]

title: cetme_model_58
body:
The CETME Model 58 is a Spanish [[battle rifle]] which was designed in mid 1950s, produced by the state-owned [i]Centro de Estudios TÃ©cnicos de Materiales Especiales[/i] (CETME). Chambered for 7.62Ã—51mm NATO and utilizes standard 20-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]], its design consists of stamped metal receiver and roller-delayed blowback mechanism. 

It became the basis of the more well-known [[H&K G3|G3]], while both [[weapon]]s are visually similar, especially to the early G3 models with a wooden  buttstock and a handguard with large perforations (post #3845109 for example). 

h4. See also
* [[CETME Model L]]
* [[List of weapons]] 

h4. External links
* "GunDigest.com":[https://gundigest.com/military-firearms/the-cetme-model-58-roller-locks-go-mainstream]
* Wikipedia: "CETME rifle":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CETME_rifle]

title: h&k_g3
body:
The G3 is a West German 7.62Ã—51mm NATO [[battle rifle]] developed by [[Heckler & Koch]] in the 1950s, based on the earlier Spanish [[CETME Model 58]]. It became the standard [[Bundeswehr]] service [[rifle]] from 1959 until early 1990s. Utilizing roller-delayed blowback mechanism, and having major variants available with fixed buttstock or retractable metal one, its design also became the basis of other H&K [[weapon]]s such as the [[h&k MP5|MP5]] [[submachine gun]]. 

This tag includes all existing variants of the G3 rifle, such as the accurized G3/SG1 for designated marksman purpose, the Swedish Ak 4, and more.

h4. See also
* [[G3 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

title: hong_kong
body:
A Special Administrative Region and [[city]] of the [[China|People's Republic of China]]. Formerly a British outpost, it grew into one of the largest and wealthiest cities in East Asia. Known for its [[neon lights]] and extremely densely packed buildings that heavily influenced the [[cyberpunk]] genre.

In 2019, the Chinese government applied more pressure to the city, causing the [[2019-2020 Hong Kong protests]].

h4. Landmarks

title: pauldrons
body:
A form of [[shoulder armor]], usually made from metal. They often protect the armpit as well as the back and chest, either separately or as part of a large breastplate.

A closely related form of armor is spaulders, which are made of smaller overlapping plates that cover just the shoulder and top of the forearm. Due to continuous misuse of the former "spaulders" tag, on Danbooru, spaulders are now tagged as pauldrons.

h6. Other elements of arm armor
* [[Rerebrace]], for the upper arms.
* [[Couter]], for the elbows.
* [[Vambraces]], for the forearms.
* [[Gauntlets]], for the hands.

title: yujin_mikotoba
body:
Recurring character in [[The Great Ace Attorney]]; he is the father of [[Susato Mikotoba]] and the mentor/foster father of [[Kazuma Asogi]]. He has [[hair slicked back|slicked back]] [[black hair]] with a [[grey hair|grey streak]] down the middle, and wears a [[blue haori]] over a [[yellow kimono]] and [[brown hakama]] [[hakama pants|pants]]. He can also be seen wearing a [[blue suit]] in the second game.

[spoiler]He is the equivalent of [[John Hamish Watson|Dr. Watson]] from [[The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes]], having written down his stories of his many adventures of working as [[Herlock Sholmes]]'s investigative partner in his youth.[/spoiler]

body:

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[black eyes]] and wears a [[yellow kimono]] with a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[hakama skirt]].

title: oklahoma_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the battleship USS [i]Oklahoma[/i] (BB-37) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. 
Character designed by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]].

h5. Base Art

Oklahoma has [[short hair|short]] [[platinum blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[strapless shirt|strapless]] button-up [[shirt]]. Brown leather with [[fringe trim]] appears to be the material for the rest of her outfit which consists of a shoulder piece, [[detached sleeves]], a [[miniskirt]] with a [[side slit]], and [[knee boots]].

Her [[rigging]] is a split-ship design with her bow on her right, and her stern on her left. Each hull has two [[ship turret|turrets]], a triple barrel turret and a superfiring twin turret. A [[crane_(machine)|mechanical crane]] and a [[smokestack]] are present on her back-rigging. She has a [[utility belt]] holding battleship shells. Several secondary turrets are present, including a handheld turret.

h5. Retrofit Art

In her [[retrofit (azur lane)|retrofit]], she wears a white [[halterneck]] connected to a metal [[collar]], which has an [[anchor]]. Her brown clothing with fringe trim includes a shoulderless [[capelet]] attached to the same place as her halter top, a miniskirt with no slit this time, and some [[leg warmers]]. She wears some thick [[brown gloves]] with fringe trim that flares out, as well as some thinner gloves reaching to about her elbow. 

Her rigging post retrofit experiences a similar change to her sister. She has a twin-hull design with the hull on her right marked with "37," and her turrets adopt a different orientation. On one of her twin-turrets, a [[aircraft catapult]] can be seen.  

h4. Skins
* !post #2932477: Default
* !post #3104486: [[oklahoma (retrofit) (azur lane)|Retrofit]]
* !post #5804044: [[oklahoma (piratey transformation!) (azur lane)|Piratey Transformation!]]

h4. [i]Nevada[/i]-class Battleships

* [b]Oklahoma[/b] (BB-37)

title: uss_oklahoma_(bb-37)
body:
[b]USS Oklahoma (BB-37)[/b] was the second and last of the [i]Nevada[/i]-class [[battleship]]s built for the [[United States Navy]]. The ship was laid down in 1912 and launched two years later in 1914. The vessel participated in America's involvement in [[World War I]] and helped evacuate American citizens and refugees fleeing the [[Spanish Civil War]] in 1936 before being assigned to the Pacific.

In the opening minutes of the attack on [[Pearl Harbor]], Oklahoma was targeted by Japanese torpedo bombers to devastating effect, hitting the vessel with five to eight [[torpedo]]es in almost as many minutes and causing her to roll over until the ship's superstructure dug into the bottom of the harbor. Salvage operations after the attack deemed the ship too badly damaged to be returned to service, making Oklahoma one of only two battleships permanently lost to the attack. 

Oklahoma was officially decommissioned in 1944 and sold for scrap in 1946, but while being towed in 1947 from Hawaii to the scrapyard in California, Oklahoma and her tugs encountered a storm which swamped the hasty repairs to make the former battleship seaworthy. Oklahoma abruptly sank, her exact whereabouts unknown.

The berth at Pearl Harbor where Oklahoma sank is still in use today, occupied by the museum ship [[USS Missouri (BB-63)]].

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as personifications outside of established franchises. 

h4. Depictions

* [[Oklahoma (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Oklahoma (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Oklahoma (Pacific)]]

h4. [i]Nevada[/i]-class battleships

* [[USS Nevada (BB-36)]]
* [b]USS Oklahoma (BB-37)[/b]

title: gawr_gura
body:
A former [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], part of Generation 1, of [[hololive English]] (also known as [[holoMyth]]). A shark-loving Atlantean who came to the surface because she finds it boring down in the ocean. She was designed by [[Amashiro Natsuki]].

She was one of the most subscribed VTubers, having surpassed VTuber pioneer [[Kizuna Ai]] back in 2021. 

On April 16, 2025, "she announced":[https://www.youtube.com/live/7WFg2wq10rw?feature=shared] that she would be graduating from hololive, with her "final stream":[https://youtu.be/EAdh6m3E3UI] on May 1st.

She is a [[shark girl]] with [[sharp teeth]] and a [[shark tail]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] or [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], her default hairstyle consists of a [[two side up]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[shark hair ornament]]s.

title: nevada_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
The retrofit version of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Nevada (azur lane)|]].

In this look, she adopts a different approach to the western-style, wearing now a [[poncho]] with fringe trim and [[chaps]]. She also sports a pair of [[wrist guards]], with a red cloth tied around her right wrist. She now sports a [[corset]] and a white top with an [[underboob cutout]], and a pair of [[short shorts]] which go over her garter straps. Throughout her clothing are red and blue ropes used to fasten her clothes.

Her rigging changes slightly to twin hull design with the left hull being marked "36." The triple turrets are now placed such that they rotate in a vertical circle, while her superfiring turrets seem to angled upwards at the base. A [[aircraft catapult]] can be seen on her left twin turret.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3170293: Profile

title: nevada_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the battleship USS [i]Nevada[/i] (BB-36) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. 
Character designed by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]].

Nevada has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with some [[hair over one eye]] and [[yellow eyes]]. Her uniform is [[cowboy western]]-styled, featured what appears to be tanned-hide on her [[puffy short sleeves]], [[fingerless gloves]] and [[overskirt]], with [[fringe trim]] on these pieces. Under the western outfit pieces, she wears a corset-like [[strapless_shirt|strapless]] [[white shirt]], a [[pencil skirt]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]]. She also wears [[red_footwear|red]] [[rudder_footwear|rudder]], and [[red ascot]].

Her [[rigging]] is a split-ship design, with her bow section on her left, and her stern section on her right. On each hull, a unique arrangement of one triple barrel [[ship turret|turret]] and one superfiring twin turret. On her back, her superstructure can be seen, as [[crane_(machine)|mechanical crane]]. She has several battleship shells carried in a [[utility belt]].

h4. Appearance

title: uss_nevada_(bb-36)
body:
[b]USS Nevada (BB-36)[/b] was the class leader of the [i]Nevada[/i]-class [[battleship]]s built for the [[United States Navy]]. The ship was laid down in 1912 and launched two years later in 1914.

Nevada saw active service during both [[World War I]] and [[World War II]], including famously being the only battleship to get underway during the attack on [[Pearl Harbor]]. After repairs were completed, Nevada served as naval fire support during the [[Invasion of Normandy]], and landings on [[Iwo Jima]] and [[Okinawa]], among others. 

After the war, Nevada was one of the vessels selected to serve in the 1946 [[Operation Crossroads]] nuclear tests at Bikini Atoll, and was painted bright orange to serve as the aim point target for Test Able, a bomb dropped from a [[B-29 Superfortress]]. Though Nevada survived both nuclear tests, she was heavily damaged and too heavily irradiated to be repaired. Nevada was decommissioned shortly after Operation Crossroads, and in 1948 was sunk as a naval gunfire exercise target from several ships, including [[USS Iowa (BB-61)]].

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as for personifications outside of established franchises. 

h4. Depictions

* [[Nevada (Kancolle)]]

body:

* [i]NieR RepliCant[/i] - Features a [[nier (brother)|young Nier]] as Yonah's brother; exclusive to Japan. [[PlayStation 3]] exclusive, used as the base for the 2021 remake released on [[PlayStation 4]], [[Xbox One]], and [[computer|PC]].

title: arizona_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Arizona[/i] (BB-39) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. 
Character designed by [[Sa (h28085)|]], voiced by Shirakabe Sawako.


She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[aqua eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[military uniform|Navy uniform]] comprising a [[blue dress]] top with [[frilled sleeves]], blue [[mini hat]], [[black belt]], [[blue skirt]] with [[side slit]], [[white thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[black gloves]], and black [[high heel boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her distinctive tripod mast-and-bridge plus three of her historical 356 mm triple gun mounts on a single bow rig that she sits on.

title: kanami_kaito
body:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber]] from [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]]' second generation. Character design by [[Nihakusanren]]. Shares the same designer with [[Faelie Fallwood]] and [[Cora Light]]. Her debut was postponed twice due to personal reasons, in which she ended up debuting on August 26, 2024 instead.

On September 23, 2024, Kanami announced that she would graduate from NEXAS the day after.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[brown hair]] with [[blonde hair|yellow]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[cat ears]], a [[blue hairband]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[slit pupils]].

Her outfit consists of a [[brown shirt|brown]] [[cropped shirt]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[white jacket]] with [[puffy long sleeves]], [[black gloves]], a [[brown bag]] with many items including a [[weighing scale]], a [[lantern]] and a [[scroll]], [[brown pants|brown]] [[puffy pants]], [[white socks]] and [[black shoes]].

* !asset #23285445: Profile

h4. External links

* "Twitter account":[https://twitter.com/Kanami_Kaito]
* "YouTube account":[https://youtube.com/@KanamiKaito]

title: msn_messenger
body:
The flagship instant messaging software of [[Microsoft Windows]], and a direct competitor to [[AIM (messenger)|]]. It is represented by the four-color [[butterfly]] icon.

It was later given the name Windows Live Messenger, featuring translucent blue and green user icons instead.

title: walkman_e_series
body:
Series of [[digital walkman|Walkman player]]s from the 2000s designed to be entry-level products for an affordable price.

Most of the models are standard [[digital media player]]s with a rounded shape and a three-button control scheme. A small, visually distinct subgroup is the buttonless, elongated [[Walkman E500]] series.

body:

body:

title: dark_daroach
body: The penultimate boss of [[Kirby: Squeak Squad]]. Once [[Daroach]] opens the treasure chest he fought against [[Kirby]] over, the malicious entity [[Dark Nebula]] is released and takes control of his body, giving him a dark blue and purple color scheme. After his defeat, Dark Nebula escapes and Kirby gives chase into the final boss.

title: technomaid_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] within [[Technoblade]]'s fan community, originally derived from a viral [[draw this in your style challenge|DTIYS challenge]] by fanartist "qarameiio":https://x.com/qarameiio/status/1319118972181118977, depicting a humanized Techno in a maid dress with a gun.

It spread beyond that initial challenge into a recurring joke, due to "maid" rhyming with "blade".

h4. See also

* [[Techno-chan]]

title: arms_up
body:
When both arms are raised up, around eye level or above.

If only one arm is raised, use [[arm up]] instead.

If the arms are reaching forwards, away from the body, use [[outstretched arms]] instead.

If the arms are spread out perpendicularly to the sides, use [[spread arms]] instead.

h4. Examples

title: luna_(treeplanting)
body:
An original character created by [[Treeplanting]].

The [[Sun (treeplanting)|youngest]] of [[Sensei (blue archive)|]] and [[Hina (blue archive)|]]'s 2 daughters, Luna is a student of Millenium, and wields an [[assault rifle]]. She's a [[demon girl]] characterized by her triangular [[black halo]] with a [[crescent]] design, though her horns curl backwards, and she has a unique [[back tattoo]] due to her father's role as an outsider.

She often wears a black [[sleeveless shirt]] with an [[off shoulder]] [[white jacket]], largely taking apperance from Millenium's design philosophy.

title: sun_(treeplanting)
body:
An original character created by [[Treeplanting]].

The [[Luna (treeplanting)|eldest]] of [[Sensei (blue archive)|]] and [[Hina (blue archive)|]]'s 2 daughters, Sun is a student of Gehenna, and wields a [[machine gun]]. She's a [[demon girl]] characterized by her [[black halo]] with a [[pentagram]] design, though her horns curl backwards, and she has a unique [[back tattoo]] due to her father's role as an outsider.

She often wears a black [[military uniform]], largely taking apperance from Gehenna's design philosophy.

title: techno-chan
body:
A [[genderswap (mtf)|MTF genderswap]] version of [[Technoblade]], a meme which has been acknowledged by Techno himself and became popular among his fans.

She is frequently depicted as a stereotypical anime girl, based on a "Superchat donation":https://www.reddit.com/r/Technoblade/comments/x4d7n3/guys_i_found_the_full_technochan_donation/ reading "Hi everyone! My name is Techno-chan! I'm just an ordinary 21-year old Minecraft player uwu. I like to stab orphan-kun heehee."

Often portrayed in a [[serafuku]] and carrying [[toast]] (or a [[potato]]) in her mouth.

h4. See also

* [[Technomaid (meme)|]]

title: mikhail_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
An NPC in [i][[Honkai: Star Rail]][/i], a former member of the Nameless and The Watchmaker of Penacony. His full name is [b]Mikhail Char Legwork[/b]. 

[spoilers]His innocent childhood dreams manifested into a memetic entity, [[Misha (Honkai: Star Rail)|]].[/spoilers] As with him, he is voiced by [[Matsui Eriko]]. 

He is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[white hair]] and [[purple eyes]]; while his outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], dark [[blue vest]], white [[ascot]], and [[black pants]], plus an optional [[black hat|black]] [[fedora]] and golden [[monocle]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8768299: "For Tomorrow's Journey" Light Cone

body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. 

A roaming Knight of Beauty. Voiced by Tachibana Shinnosuke in Japanese. 
He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair|red]] hair and [[green eyes]]. His default outfit, fitting of his role, consists of a grey [[full armor]] set, [[red shirt]], and [[black pants]].

title: boothill_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the Galaxy Rangers. Voiced by [[Konishi Katsuyuki]] (JP) and [[Andrew Russell]] (EN). 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[hair over one eye|covering his right eye]], [[black eyes]] with [[crosshair pupils]], and [[mechanical arms]] and [[cyborg|torso]]. His default outfit, fitting of his occupation, consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[cowboy hat]], [[bullet earrings]], [[red cape]], [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]], [[brown belt|brown]] [[ammunition belt]], [[black pants]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], and a [[thigh holster]] for his [[revolver]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7691450: Splash art
* !post #8768050: Sailing Towards a Second Life (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
"So, here's the thing: someone went and tinkered with my Synesthesia Beacon, so now, all you folks can hear is me and those adorable little troublemakers talkin' like this... cutie, cutie, cutie. Looky here, see?"

A cyborg cowboy drifting among the stars. Extremely optimistic and unrestrained.
He is a member of the Galaxy Rangers who swore to punish the wretched by any and all means...
His flamboyant and brash actions were all to draw the attention of the Interastral Peace Corporation â€” the target of his revenge.
[/expand]

title: moze_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. Voiced by [[Sakata Shougo]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[purple eyes]]; while his outfit consists of a [[purple shirt]], [[purple cape|purple]] [[waist cape]] held by a [[black belt]], [[purple jacket|purple]] [[hooded jacket]], [[black gloves]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8148766: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Some people are silent because they have no desires. Some are silent because they have no thoughts. I am silent only because I do not wish to speak."

A Shadow Guard of the Yaoqing. He is reticent and silent, always acting on his own. As an expert in intelligence services and other affairs that must remain obscure, Moze rarely shows himself before others. The moment he shows his true capacities is usually the moment for his enemies to face death.

He has a wealth of knowledge regarding methods of assassination and seems to have an extraordinary obsession with tidiness and cleanliness.
[/expand]

title: raiden_mei_(shadow_dash)
body:
Shadow Dash is [[raiden_mei|Mei]]'s anti-humanoid focused battlesuit with homage to the Far East's "samurai". 

She sacrifices top end speed for higher defensive capabilities due to almosta full set of plated armour including additional furnishings to help stave off any ranged or melee attacks. In doing so she also employs usage of "shadows" that are summoned temporal clones of herself that bait out opponents attacks meanwhile Mei herself can backstab them while their focus is on the "shadow".

title: raiden_mei_(valkyrie_bladestrike)
body: The Valkyrie Bladestrike battlesuit is [[raiden_mei|Mei]]'s special Schicksal Far East Branch Valkyrie uniform. The battlesuit itself sacrificed armour plating for higher mobility due to lighter materials utilised and minimal strain on the user's body. The sleeves are woven using special fibres with the ability to deflect bladed attacks which further enhances Mei's defensive abilities, and mobility in melee battles.

title: daikou-chan
body:
The original avatar character of the [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] [[Kson]] (as opposed to Kson [[real life|herself]]).

Daikou-chan wears a [[black dress|black]] [[china dress]] with a [[cleavage]] [[cleavage cutout|cutout]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] or [[detached sleeves]], [[glasses]], and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied up in a [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[high ponytail]]. Usually out of sight, but still present in her design, are [[red shorts|red]] [[print shorts]], [[fishnet pantyhose]], and [[red soles|red-soled]] [[black shoes]].

body:

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] stylized in a [[side ponytail]] with bangs. She wears [[glasses]], a [[shuriken]] [[hair ornament]], [[short kimono|short]] [[pink kimono]], [[red sash|red]] [[sash]], [[fishnet shorts]], and [[toeless legwear]].

The default costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Amiya Aranha]].

This costume consists of a [[white dress]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s, [[blue bow]]s, and a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[white hairband|white]] [[lolita hairband]] with two black [[hair ribbon]]s, and [[purple footwear|purple]] [[platform footwear]] with [[tube socks]]. She wears a [[single leg pantyhose|single]] [[fishnet pantyhose|fishnet]] on her right leg and a [[purple ribbon]] on her left.

In this look, she wears her hair in [[braid|braided]] [[two side up]].

title: kayano_futaba
body:
[[Denonbu]] character and a member of Sotokanda Literature High Schoolâ€™s [[denonbu|electronic music club]] in the Akiba area. 

She has [[blonde hair]], which is tied into low pony tails, and [[orange eyes]].

Futaba, much like the other girls in the club, wears the [[school uniform]].

However, just like the other members of the club, she wears a [[hoodie]], which is wrapped around her waist. Her hoodie is mainly [[green hoodie|green]] with pink, black and white details.

Accessory-wise, she has [[hair tie]]s which match her hoodie, a [[green scrunchie]] around her wrist, and dark [[thighhighs]].

When she enters "Idol-mode", her hairstyle changes to [[twintails]] and the hair decorations on her hair increase and become star-shaped.

h4. Official art

* !post #5658347

title: clown_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The transcendent version of the [[Bard (ragnarok online)|]] from [[Ragnarok Online]], localized as Minstrel on the international server. Only males can become Clowns. Can be equipped with [[holding bow (weapon)|bows]], but more commonly are seen with various [[holding instrument|instruments]] such as [[lute (instrument)|]]s or [[guitar]]s. Named characters: [[Alphoccio Basil]]

They wear a [[sleeveless coat|sleeveless]] [[brown coat]] over a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[purple pants|purple]] [[two-tone pants|and]] [[brown pants]], and [[brown boots]]. A very common headwear for them is a [[multicolored hat|multicolored]] [[jester cap]].

h4. Appearance

body:
The uniform worn by members of the Ginkgo Guild in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|PokÃ©mon Legends: Arceus]][/i].

It consists of a [[blue jumpsuit]], a [[white apron]] with the Guild's emblem [[print apron|printed]] on it, [[brown boots]], and a [[yellow hat|yellow]] and [[blue hat|blue]] [[multicolored hat]]. [[Ginter (pokemon)|]]'s hat also has a metallic crest with the Guild's emblem on it. Members also carry a [[brown bag|brown]] [[backpack]] with some smaller bags attached to its sides.

title: yuegui_(genshin_impact)
body: An adeptus gadget gifted to [[Yaoyao (Genshin Impact)|]]. It looks like a yellow and white, [[stuffed toy]] rabbit. She uses it as a part of her overall kit.

title: leviathan_(skullgirls)
body:
A character in [[Skullgirls]].

A serpentine parasite who symbiotically lives inside the zombie [[Squigly (skullgirls)|]]. His presence prevents Squigly from becoming an undead servant of the Skullgirl.

Having been passed through the Contiello family for generations, Leviathan is refined and dotes on Squigly like her father, his previous host. This long familial history has made Squigly's bond with Leviathan deeper and more fundamental than that of most Parasites, and allows them to work harmoniously both in and out of battle like synchronized dance partners. Their unique circumstance also seems to have given them abilities beyond this world, as well.

title: hanazuki_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hanazuki[/i]. Character designed by [[Shirokitsune]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[green eyes]], [[fox ears]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[pink kimono]] with [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]], a dark [[red hakama]] with [[hip vent]]s and a [[floral print]], [[hair flower]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]] with [[rudder footwear|rudders]] in place of the heels. Her [[rigging]] consists of two 100 mm twin gun mounts placed one to each side, 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]], her funnel to her back, and a [[parasol]].

title: colorado_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Personification]] of the nameship of the USS Colorado-class battleships with the callsign BB-45 as depicted in [[Azur Lane]], and also one of the "Big Seven". She was initially introduced alongside her sisters in Fallen Wings event on the Chinese server in December 2017. However, a conflict between Yostar and the artist that designed Colorado and her sisters had made the event delayed for other servers until October 2018 when another artist was commissioned to redesign her.

Her "original design" by [[Rail (Silverbow)]] (post #2973322) portrays her with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], wears a blue and white [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], a [[white thighhighs]] and a pair of white [[cross-laced_footwear|cross-laced]] [[high heel boots]] that displays her hull number. She also wears a [[garrison cap]] with a [[hat feather]].

Eventually on October 2018, Yostar commissioned another artist, [[Chuzenji]] to redesign her. Under the redesign (post #3297428), Colorado and her sisters is now themed after gothic vampires. For Colorado, she now sports a long [[white hair]]. She still wears a sleeveless shirt albeit now in black and white and showing her [[sideboob]], as well as a black [[coat]]. Her legwear is now changed to a cross-laced [[thigh_boots|thighhigh boots]] and no longer having a cap.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3297428: Default
* !post #7756941: [[colorado (retrofit) (azur lane)|Retrofit]]

title: monarch_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] battleship HMS [i]Monarch[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. 
Character design by [[Liduke]], voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

Monarch is portrayed as a [[large_breasts|large-breasted]], [[purple_eyes|purple-eyed]] [[red_hair|redhead]] wearing a stylized Royal Navy uniform with an admiral's sleeve insignia, with a [[peaked cap]], [[thumb ring]]s, [[black gloves]], [[black jacket]] [[jacket_on_shoulders|around her shoulders]] with [[aiguillette]] and [[epaulettes]], and [[black thighhighs]]. 

Her rigging consists of her triple 381 mm guns as well as her secondary battery of four 133 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]], while she uses a [[scepter]] as her melee weapon.

title: aeug
body:
A fictional [[military]] organization from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

The [b]Anti Earth Union Group[/b] ([i]HanchikyÅ« RempÅ Soshiki[/i]), more commonly known by their acronym as the [b]AEUG[/b] ([i]E~Å«go[/i]), [b]AG[/b] or more correctly translated, the [b]Anti United Earth Government Group[/b], is the main protagonist faction of Mobile Suit [[Zeta Gundam]] and Mobile Suit [[Gundam ZZ]]. The AEUG is an anti-Federation movement which initially opposed the oppressive [spoilers]genocidal[/spoilers] tactics of the Federation's elite [[titans (gundam)|Titans taskforce]]. It was formed by [[earth federation space forces|EFSF]] and [[Zeon]] One Year War veterans mostly and was founded and commandered by [[Blex Forer]] while supplied by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. They have several large [[military]] [[spacecraft]] and [[mobile suit]]s in its ranks. The [[Argama]] is the flagship of the AEUG.

[b]Karaba[/b] was a smaller Earth based resistance organization allied with the AEUG in its fight against the Titans. The [[Dijeh]] is a notable MS produced and deployed by this faction that was used by [[amuro ray|a legendary figure]] from [[mobile suit gundam|The One Year War.]]

During [[gundam zz|The First Neo Zeon War]] both the AEUG and Karaba fought against [[Neo Zeon]]. [spoilers]At the end of this conflict the remaining AEUG/Karaba forces were integrated into the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] and became the core of the famous [[char's counterattack|Londo Bell Unit]].[/spoilers]

h4. Notable members

title: sarah_zabiarov
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] universe. She first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] series from 1985.

[b]Sarah Zabiarov[/b] is a very young Cyber-Newtype [[Mobile Suit]] [[pilot]] cadet at the service of the [[Titans (gundam)|]]. Her [[mecha]] of choice are the [[Hizack]], the [[Marasai]], the [[Gabthley]], the [[Palace Athene]] and the [[Bolinoak Sammahn]].

[spoilers]She dies during one of the final battles of The Gryps War while trying to protect [[Paptimus Scirocco]] in [[The O (Mobile suit)|]] from a surprise attack by [[Katz Howan|Katz Kobayashi]] in his [[G-Defenser]], who unwillingly destroys Sarah's Bolinoak instead.[/spoilers]

title: fraw_bow
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] series. She first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979 and also appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] (1985).

[b]Fraw Bow[/b] is [[Amuro Ray]]'s neighbor and best friend at the begining of the series. She  later becomes part of the junior crew of the [[White Base]] [[Earth Federation]] [[spacecraft]]. 

[spoilers]After the events of the original Gundam, Fraw married [[Hayato Kobayashi]], became pregnant with his child, and adopted orphans [[Katz Howan]], [[Letz Cofan]], and [[Kikka Kitamoto]]. Despite all that however she is still in love with Amuro Ray. During [[Zeta Gundam]] Katz is killed in the Battle of Gryps, and though she does not appear in [[Gundam ZZ]] she was tragically widowed when Hayato was killed during the [[Colony Drop]] on Dublin, [[Ireland]].[/spoilers]

title: grisaia_battlefield_barcarolle
body: Second mobile/browser spinoff entry in the [[Grisaia_(series)|Grisaia]] franchise after [[Grisaia Chronos Rebellion]], and sequel to [[Grisaia no Rakuen]]. Set in a sci-fi/fantasy themed VRMMO similar to [[Sword Art Online]], with gacha and RPG mechanics and gameplay. Launched on April 4, 2022, with service ending on March 23, 2023. Had both a non-eroge and eroge version (Grisaia Battlefield Barcarolle X), with H-scenes in the form of animated and non-animated collectible CGs.

title: help:wiki
body:
h4. About Danbooru Wiki

The Danbooru Wiki exists to provide information about topics relevant to the site. 
Primarily, wiki entries are used to explain the usage of the various tags given to posts. 
In addition, the wiki include various information about usage of the site.

h4. Search

The quick search bar will search for titles only. 
For more advanced searching, use the "wiki search page":/wiki_pages.

h4. Wiki pages structure

h5. The body of the page
The body of the page contains the main reference content. 
Tag pages can include additional tag names above the body of the page. See [[help:translated_tags]].

h5. Left column

* "Wiki Page History":/wiki_page_versions (second name "Recent Changes") contains changelog of a wiki pages. 
* [i]Options[/i] menu for the page:
** Tag History - "posts history":/post_versions for the selected tag on the wiki
** Wiki History - history for the current page
** Discussions - linked a "forum topics":/forum_topics with the current page
** What Links Here - linked another wiki a topics with the current page

h5. Managing wiki pages

* New - create wiki page
* Edit - edit selected page
* History - all changes current page
* Delete/Undelete - aviable on edit mode, mark/unmark this wiki page as deleted.

To begin editing a wiki article click the 'edit' button located in the nav-bar or by pressing 'e' on the keyboard when viewing a wiki article . (You can also add '[code]/edit[/code]' to the end of a wiki page URL)

Refer to the [[howto:wiki]] article for guidelines on how wiki articles should be written.

h4. See also

* [[api:wiki page versions]]
* [[api:wiki pages]]

title: scamp_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Scamp[/i], hull number SS-277, sixty-sixth of seventy-seven Gato-class submarines of the United States Navy.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[side ponytail]], [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]] and [[star hair ornament]] and [[grey eyes]]. She wear a [[aqua hat|aqua]] [[garrison cap]], [[black one-piece swimsuit|black]] [[highleg one-piece swimsuit|highleg]] [[competition swimsuit]], [[white gloves]], torn [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]].

Scamp's personality is somewhat synonymous with what her name denotes: Impish and a little sexual. No thanks to her history, however, she is averse to kaiboukan, especially [[Kaiboukan No. 4 (kancolle)|]].

She is the first ever American and Allied submarine in the game as well as the first foreign submarine who never became part of the IJN. As with all American submarines during WWII, she is named after a marine creature, in her case "a species of grouper fish":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scamp_grouper].

She was illustrated by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]].

h4. [i]Gato[/i]-class submarines
* [[Drum (kancolle)|]] (SS-228)
* [[Wahoo (kancolle)|]] (SS-238)
* [b]Scamp[/b] (SS-277)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: USS Scamp (SS-277)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Scamp_(SS-277)]

title: glowing_hot
body:
The glow produced from the heating of a material, particularly metal.  Goes from an initial red glow to a bright white and then potential blue glow the higher the material is heated.

Commonly referred to as glowing hot or red-hot.

title: pincers_(tool)
body:
A tool similar to [[pliers]] that is used to pinch, cut or pull an object.  They differ from pliers by concentrating the force to a point or edge that is perpendicular to the length of the tool.  They're designed so that the end of the jaws can be brought close to surfaces, such as when working to remove [[nail (hardware)|]]s from wood.

Pincers heated until they're [[glowing_hot|red hot]] have been used as a tool for [[torture]] since roman times.

h4. See also

* [[Pliers]]
* [[Tongs]]
* [[Tweezers]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pincers (tool)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pincers_(tool)]

body:
A Chinese internet meme. An old man is sitting on the subway, looking at his phone and frowning. Describes seeing something unacceptable on the Internet (mainly when using a phone).

[[Honkai: Star Rail]] incorporates one of the character [[Welt Yang]]'s standby actions into this meme. The main story text "the Express. Welt. Phone." is also an example of the use of this meme.

title: uss_arizona_(bb-39)
body:
The [b]USS Arizona (BB-39)[/b] was the second and last of the [i]Pennsylvania[/i]-class [[battleship]]s built for the [[United States Navy]]. The ship was laid down in 1914 and commissioned two years later in 1916.

Arizona is infamously known as one of only two battleships permanently lost to the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] during the Attack on [[Pearl Harbor]] on 7 December 1941, and the only one that was completely destroyed. While the other damaged vessels were able to be recovered after the attack, Arizona suffered a magazine detonation that blew the ship's bow apart, giving Arizona the dubious distinction of having suffered the highest loss of life from a single vessel in the U.S. Navy's history. After the war, the [[USS Arizona Memorial]] was built over its wreck.

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as personifications outside of established franchises. 

h4. Depictions

* [[Arizona (Azur Lane)]]
** [[Arizona (META) (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Arizona (Pacific)]]
* [[Arizona (Blue Oath)]]
* [[Arizona (Victory Belles)]]

h4. [i]Pennsylvania[/i]-class battleships

* [[USS Pennsylvania (BB-38)]]
* [b]USS Arizona (BB-39)[/b]

title: no-rin
body:
A 2011-current light novel series by Shiratori Shirou, with illustrations by [[Kippu]], published by SoftBank Creative's GA Bunko imprint.

Eleventh-grader [[Hata Kousaku]] fell into a depression following the sudden retirement of Kusakabe Yuka, a nationally-renowned idol singer of his age, only to discover a few days later that she transferred into his alma mater, Tamo Agricultural School, under her real name, [[Kinoshita Ringo (No-Rin)|Kinoshita Ringo]]. Together with his childhood friends [[Nakazawa Minori]] and [[Kamatori Kei]], Kousaku takes the rare opportunity to learn what is she doing in the countryside, and perhaps befriend her.

h4. Characters

* [[Hata Kousaku]]
* [[Kinoshita Ringo (No-Rin)|Kinoshita Ringo]]

An image that depict a character, vehicle, or mecha with a derivative design from the original i.e. a "fan-made" design. This includes fan designs of un-seen characters.

For an alternate design made by official source, use [[official alternate design]] instead.

title: marquis_de_lafayette
body: Marie-Joseph Paul Yves Roch Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de La Fayette (6 September 1757 â€“ 20 May 1834).

title: brick
body:
A small rectangular block typically made of fired or sun-dried clay, stone or concrete. Used for [[building]] structures or [[pavement]]s.

This tag should be used for individual pieces of bricks, not being part of a common structure.

h4. See also
* [[brick floor]]
* [[brick road]]
* [[brick wall]]
* [[building block]]

title: fatass_teto_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] about [[UTAU]] [[Kasane Teto]] being fat. It seems to have become popularized sometime in 2024 when someone posted a picture of the Fukuya Teto plushie seen from the side, commenting on how fat she looked.

* !asset #26008403: Osuwari Big Nuigurumi ("sitting big plushie") by Fukuya

h4. External link

* "MyFigureCollection entry for the plushie in question":[https://myfigurecollection.net/item/1821420]

title: lapras
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|PokÃ©mon]] #0131 in the National PokÃ©dex, a Water/Ice-type.

Lapras is a blue [[plesiosaur]]id PokÃ©mon with a hard grey shell on its back. Known for its unusually friendly altitude towards humans compared to other PokÃ©mon. As such, it is frequently used as a [[riding_pokemon|mode of transport]] between water bodies in the PokÃ©mon world.

It has a [[Gigantamax]] form.

Japanese name: [b]Laplace[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #9395026: Lapras
* !post #9395043: [[Gigantamax Lapras]]

Next PokÃ©mon: [[Ditto]]

title: love_it!_wonderful_trip!
body:
A song from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]] performed by [[Hinoshita Kaho]], [[Murano Sayaka]], and [[Osawa Rurino]]. It is included in the album [[Oide yo! Ishikawa Daikanko]].

Notable features include animal motifs, like Kaho as a [[rabbit]], Sayaka as a [[bird]], and Rurino as a [[dog]].

title: gyarados
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|PokÃ©mon]] #0130 in the National PokÃ©dex, a Water/Flying-type.

A giant, draconic serpent, its body is accented with spiked [[fins]], its massive maw with viscious [[fangs]] and thin, drawn [[whiskers]], and its forehead with a tri-point crest.

Evolves from [[Magikarp]]. It can also [[mega_pokemon|Mega Evolve]].

Japanese name: [b]Gyarados[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #9394989: Gyarados
* !post #9395004: [[Mega Gyarados]]

Next PokÃ©mon: [[Lapras]]

title: magikarp
body:
[[Pokemon_(creature)|PokÃ©mon]] #0129 in the National PokÃ©dex, a Water-type.

A [[fish]] PokÃ©mon with a red or orange body, wide eyes, and long yellow [[whiskers]], with its dorsal fin resembling a crown. It is often considered, along with the similar [[Feebas]] as the weakest PokÃ©mon in the entire game due to being able to use only a single move, [[Splash (pokemon)|]], which deals no damage.

Evolves into [[Gyarados]].

Japanese name: [b]Koiking[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #9394946

title: barbie_(franchise)
body:
A doll franchise oriented around its titular character, [[Barbie (character)|]], which has existed since 1959. The brand spread into a media franchise from the late 1980s onwards, spawning films, shows, etc. It is owned by [[united_states|American]] toy company "MATTEL, INC.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mattel

title: gilles_de_rais_(caster)_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. A Caster-class Servant who appears in [[Fate/Zero]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

A tall, gaunt man with big popping eyes, a long nose and [[black hair]], wearing a wizard's robe.

Often seen with his Master [[Uryuu Ryuunosuke]]. 

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Azusa (hws)|]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]])
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Tsuruoka Satoshi]]

h4. Appearance
* !post #2097120: [[Fate/Zero]]
* !post #9107791: First Ascension
* !post #2134822: Second Ascension

title: sakazuki_(one_piece)
body:
[b]Admiral Akainu[/b] (real name: [b]Sakazuki[/b]) is a Marine admiral in the world of [[One Piece]], being one of the series' main antagonists.

Having consumed the Magu Magu no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he has the power to turn into and control magma.

[spoiler]Promoted to Fleet Admiral after the war against [[Edward Newgate|Whitebeard]]. He fought against [[Aokiji (one piece)|Aokiji]] for ten days straight at Punk Hazard before emerging victorious.[/spoiler]

title: edoben
body:
A Japanese dialect spoken in Tokyo. Generally considered a working-class dialect and is heavily associated with certain "downtown" wards of Tokyo located on the eastern side. This dialect is sometimes also called the Shitamachi dialect ([i]Shitamachi-kotoba[/i], lit. "Downtown Speech".)

The stereotypical phrase associated with this dialect is "beranmee" (corruption of "beranbou"), roughly meaning "bloody fool" or "frickin' idiot". Edoben is thus also sometimes called the [i]beranmee-kuchou[/i], or the "Beranmee Accent". Another common phrase is "teyandee", i.e. "The [i]hell[/i] are ya sayin'?"

Other features of this dialect includes a lack of distinction between /shi/ and /hi/ (resulting in [i]shichi[/i] sounding like "hichi"), as well as "fronting" of /ju/ to /ji/ (this results in [i]juujutsu[/i] being pronounced like "jiu-jitsu"). The sounds of /ai ae ie oi/ also tends to be converted into a long /e/ sound, resulting in [i]taihen[/i] and [i]sugoi[/i] being pronounced as "teehen" and "sugee".

Characters of the "edokko" archetype (Rowdy Child of Edo/Tokyo) tend to speak with a distinctive Edoben accent. 

Edoben is usually adapted into a colloquial-sounding English in translations, with greater emphasis on use of contractions and other colloquialisms. On Danbooru, [i]heavier[/i] accents of Edoben are sometimes adapted into "Cockney English":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cockney].

h4. Notable characters who speak Edo dialect

* [[Bloodberry]] ([[Saber Marionette J]])
* [[Chibita]] ([[Osomatsu-kun]]) 
* [[Fujibayashi Sheena]] ([[Tales of Symphonia]])
* [[Inari One (Umamusume)|]] ([[Umamusume]])
* [[Fujitora (one piece)|]] ([[One Piece]])
* [[Okita Sougo]] ([[Gintama]]) [tn]Speaks unaccented Japanese in flashback scenes[/tn]
* [[Onozuka Komachi]] ([[Touhou]]) [tn]Usually light[/tn] 
* [[Pyonkichi]] ([[Dokonjou Gaeru]])
* [[Senji Muramasa (fate)|Senji Muramasa]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]]) [tn]Also has an "old man" dialect[/tn]
* [[Suzukaze (Kancolle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]]) [tn]Heavy[/tn]
* [[Tanikaze (Kancolle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]]) [tn]Accent varies; sometimes sounds fake[/tn]
* [[Yanagiwara Maron]] ([[High School Fleet]]) 
* [[Simon Blackquill]] ([[Ace Attorney]])

title: uss_wisconsin_(bb-64)
body:
[b]USS Wisconsin (BB-64)[/b] is the fourth of the [i]Iowa[/i]-class [[battleship]]s of the [[United States Navy]]. First commissioned in 1944, it earned six battle stars from combat service in the Pacific Theater of [[World War II]], the [[Korean War]], and the [[gulf war|First Gulf War]]. The vessel was decommissioned for the last time in 1991, and is currently a museum ship in Norfolk, Virginia.

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as personifications of the ship outside of established franchises.

Set in a [[science fiction]] setting, the player takes control of a [[spacecraft]] and its crew, and must survive a series of space battles across seven sectors to defeat the Rebel Flagship and prevent the fall of the Galactic Federation. The game features a wide variety of unique races, playable spacecraft, weapons, upgrades, and randomized layouts that make each run different.
