title: uss_missouri_(bb-63)
body:
[b]USS Missouri (BB-63)[/b] is the third of the four [i]Iowa[/i]-class  [[battleship]]s built for the [[United States Navy]]. First commissioned in 1944, it earned eleven battle stars for combat service in the Pacific Theater of World War II, the [[Korean War]], and the [[gulf war|First Gulf War]]. The vessel was decommissioned for the last time in 1992, and in 1999 [i]Missouri[/i] became the first of the [i]Iowa[/i]-class to be open as a museum ship in [[Pearl Harbor]], [[Hawaii]], right beside the [[USS Arizona Memorial]].

[i]Missouri[/i] is famously known as the site of [[victory over japan day|the signing of the instrument of surrender]] of the Empire of [[Japan]] to mark the official end of [[World War II]] on September 2, 1945. In addition, the vessel has had a starring role in the 1992 movie [[Under Siege]] (though actual filming was done aboard [[USS Alabama (BB-60)]]), and the 2012 movie [[Battleship (Movie)|]].

This tag is for depictions of the actual vessel. For original personifications outside of established franchises, use [[USS Missouri (BB-63) (Personification)]].

h4. Depictions 

* [[Missouri (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Missouri (Pacific)]]

h4. [i]Iowa[/i]-class battleships 

* [[USS Iowa (BB-61)]]
* [[USS New Jersey (BB-62)]]
* [b]USS Missouri (BB-63)[/b]
* [[USS Wisconsin (BB-64)]]

title: uss_iowa_(bb-61)
body:
The lead and namesake ship of the [i]Iowa[/i]-class [[battleship]]s of the [[United States Navy]]. First commissioned in 1943, it earned eleven battle stars from combat service in both the Pacific and Atlantic Theaters of [[World War II]] as well as the [[Korean War]], and was decommissioned for the last time in 1990. It is currently a museum ship at the Port of [[Los Angeles]], [[California]].

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as personifications of the ship outside of established franchises such as [[Kantai Collection]].

h4. Depictions

body:
[b]Professor Cerise[/b], known as [b]Dr. Sakuragi[/b] (ã‚µã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚®åšå£«) in Japan, is a character introduced in the [i][[pokemon|PokÃ©mon]] [[pokemon journeys|Journeys]] anime[/i].

He has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. He wears [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] and [[brown-framed eyewear|brown-framed]] [[glasses]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[lab coat]] over a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[blue shirt]], [[grey pants]] with a [[belt buckle|buckled]] [[grey belt]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[shoes]].

title: pokemon_go
body:
A mobile app created by Niantic, Inc. and the Pokemon Company. Players take their smartphones with them, walk around, and catch [[Pokemon]], just like in the main series. The game initially included Generation I Pokemon, but began adding Generation II Pokemon in early 2017 and Generation III during the same year's Halloween event.

The game is often set as an example of a "flavor of the month" fad. Its online popularity dropped drastically a few months after its release; many blame this on the lack of updates and content on launch, Niantic, Inc.'s poor management and playerbase communication, and its freemium pay-to-win system prevalent in many other mobile games. However, despite the decrease in internet activity, it's still a popular game, and some cite the game and the release of [i][[pokemon sm|Pokemon Sun and Moon]][/i] as the causes of a resurgence in franchise popularity overall. More features being added over the course of 2017 have also drawn back some of the initial fans that dropped off for the above reasons.

On March 12, 2025, Niantic sold Pokemon GO to Scopely, the makers of Monopoly Go!.

h4. Characters

* [[Male Protagonist (Pokemon GO)|]]
* [[Female Protagonist (Pokemon GO)|]]
* [[professor willow|Professor Willow]]
* [[Candela (Pokemon)|]]
* [[Blanche (Pokemon)|]]
* [[Spark (Pokemon)|]]
* Team GO Rocket
** [[Arlo (pokemon)|]]
** [[Cliff (pokemon)|]]
** [[Sierra (pokemon)|]]

h4. External links

* "iOS App Store: Pokemon GO":https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/pokemon-go/id1094591345?mt=8

title: professor_willow
body: The professor of [i][[pokemon_go|PokÃ©mon GO]][/i], researching habitats and distribution of pokÃ©mon. He gets help from his assistants, [[candela_(pokemon)|Candela]], [[blanche_(pokemon)|Blanche]], and [[spark_(pokemon)|Spark]], through monitoring the behavior of the pokÃ©mon in their respective teams' gyms. Players can also transfer pokÃ©mon to him in exchange for candy.

title: pokemon_dream_radar
body:
Old application for the Nintendo 3DS.

[quote]
In the game you'll be taking on the role of an assistant who works for [[professor burnet|Professor Burnet]] - a scientist studying the Interdream Zone. Move your Nintendo 3DS system around in this motion-controlled action game and take aim to shoot your light beam at the Dream Clouds and collect your rewards! This game is fun for anybody, and a fact-filled accompaniment to PokÃ©mon Black Version 2 or PokÃ©mon White Version 2. Any caught PokÃ©mon or items you pick up in the PokÃ©mon Dream Radar can be transferred to PokÃ©mon Black Version 2 and PokÃ©mon White Version 2, which is very useful, since the PokÃ©mon you catch might have hidden abilities not available for those games, and some items that can't normally be found either. Try to fill up your PokÃ©dex as much as you can!
[/quote]

title: professor_kukui
body:
Prof. Kukui is a character in [[Pokemon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]], and Alola's resident PokÃ©mon expert. He is a passionate man who specializes in PokÃ©mon moves. He is married to [[Professor burnet|Prof. Burnet]].

He is also known as [b]The Masked Royal[/b] ([b]Royal Mask[/b] in the Japanese version), a famous masked wrestler and star of the Battle Royal Dome.

[spoiler]Kukui later creates Alola's own PokÃ©mon League, and is the last challenge the protagonist overcomes before becoming the League's first champion.[/spoiler]

In the [[pokemon (anime)|anime]], Kukui is a teacher at the PokÃ©mon School that Ash attended. He let him stay at his house.

title: professor_burnet
body: A woman that debuted in [[Pokemon Dream Radar]] studying the Interdream Zone. She later makes her core series debut in [[pokemon_sm|PokÃ©mon Sun and Moon]] as a researcher of the Ultra Wormhole, and is revealed to be [[professor kukui|Prof. Kukui]]'s wife.

title: arven_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Arven,[/b] known as [b]Pepper[/b] (ãƒšãƒ‘ãƒ¼) in Japan, is one of the rivals in [[Pokemon SV]].

He is the character that gifts the protagonist [[Koraidon]] or [[Miraidon]], as well as the main character of the Path of Legends storyline. Initially standoffish and quick to anger, Arven warms up to the protagonist over the game and eventually reveals that [spoiler] he is searching for the Herba Mystica in order to heal his [[Mabosstiff]], who has sustained a grevious injury.[/spoiler]

He is the son of the game's professor, [[Professor sada|Sada]] in Scarlet or [[Professor turo|Turo]] in Violet.

title: pokemon_xy_(anime)
body:
The fifth series of the [[pokemon (anime)|PokÃ©mon anime]] and is based on the events of the Generation VI core series PokÃ©mon games. It follows [[pokemon bw (anime)|PokÃ©mon the Series: Black & White]] and was succeeded by [[pokemon sm (anime)|PokÃ©mon the Series: Sun & Moon]]. It ran from October 17, 2013 to November 10, 2016 in Japan and from January 18, 2014 to January 28, 2017 in the United States.

As with the previous three series, PokÃ©mon the Series: XY began with only [[Ash Ketchum]], headed off to Kalos region with his [[Pikachu]], intending to challenge the Kalos League. Joining him this time are [[Serena (pokemon)|]], a new Trainer who previously met Ash in her childhood; [[Clemont (pokemon)|]], an aspiring inventor and scientist, who is also the Gym Leader of the Lumiose Gym; and [[Bonnie (pokemon)|]], Clemont's younger sister.

title: alain_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Alan[/b] (Japanese), [b]Alain[/b] (English)

Supporting character in the [[Pokemon XY (anime)|Pokemon XY anime]] series, and lead character in [i]The Strongest Mega Evolution[/i] side story arc. Alain is an aloof PokÃ©mon Trainer seeking to defeat all Mega Evolved PokÃ©mon with his partner, a Charizard that can Mega Evolve into [[Mega Charizard X]].

Initially an assistant to [[Professor Sycamore]], he traveled with [[Mairin (pokemon)|]], a novice Trainer. He is working with [[Lysandre (pokemon)|]], who led him to believe he can protect Sycamore and Mairin by pursuing [[Zygarde]]. He later takes an interest in [[Ash Ketchum|Ash]] and his special [[Greninja]], and becomes one of Ash's central Kalos rivals.

h4. PokÃ©mon

title: professor_sycamore
body:
[b]Augustine Sycamore[/b], known as [b]Platane[/b] (ãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŒ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|PokÃ©mon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]][/i].

This friendly PokÃ©mon Professor from Lumiose City in Kalos is researching the mysteries of Mega Evolution. His hobby is sampling food from cafÃ©s while walking around town.

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[curly hair|curly]] [[black hair]] including [[facial hair]]. He wears a [[lab coat]], a [[shirt]], a [[wristwatch]], [[black pants]], a [[yellow belt]], [[socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

title: pokemon_bw_(anime)
body:
The fourth series of the [[pokemon (anime)|PokÃ©mon anime]] and is based on the events of the Generation V core series PokÃ©mon games. It follows [[pokemon dppt (anime)|PokÃ©mon the Series: Diamond and Pearl]] and was succeeded by [[pokemon xy (anime)|PokÃ©mon the Series: XY]]. It ran from September 23, 2010 to October 3, 2013 (with a special episode on March 27, 2014) in Japan and from February 12, 2011 to December 7, 2013 in the United States.

body:
The third series of the [[pokemon (anime)|PokÃ©mon anime]] and is based on the events of the Generation IV core series PokÃ©mon games. It follows [[pokemon rse (anime)|PokÃ©mon the Series: Ruby and Sapphire]] and was succeeded by [[pokemon bw (anime)|PokÃ©mon the Series: Black & White]]. It ran from September 28, 2006 to September 9, 2010 in Japan and from June 4, 2007 to February 5, 2011 in the United States.

Like the previous series, this series begins with [[Ash Ketchum]] beginning his journey by himself, this time through the Sinnoh region, aiming to conquer the Sinnoh League. His longtime companion [[Brock (pokemon)|]] eventually rejoins him, as does [[Dawn (pokemon)|]], a rookie PokÃ©mon Coordinator from [[Twinleaf Town]] who wishes to follow in the footsteps of [[johanna (pokemon)|her mother]] and gain the title of Top Coordinator.

body:

title: pokemon_(classic_anime)
body:
The first series of the [[pokemon (anime)|PokÃ©mon anime]] and is based on the events of the core series Generation I and II PokÃ©mon games, respectively. It was succeeded by [[pokemon rse (anime)|PokÃ©mon the Series: Ruby and Sapphire]]. It ran from April 1, 1997 to November 14, 2002 in Japan and from September 7, 1998 to October 25, 2003 in the United States.

During the original series, rookie Trainer [[Ash Ketchum]] begins his journey in the Kanto region, leaving his home of [[Pallet Town]] with the only first partner PokÃ©mon that [[professor oak|Professor Oak]] had left to give: a reluctant and moody [[Pikachu]]. Ash's quest begins in earnest to defeat all of the Gym Leaders and get to the PokÃ©mon League as soon as he has gained Pikachu's trust, and he is joined by two mentors, [[Misty (pokemon)|]] and [[Brock (pokemon)|]].

title: vietnamese_flag
body:
The flag of [[Vietnam]], or "red flag with a gold star" (cá» Ä‘á» sao vÃ ng), was designed in 1940 and used during an uprising against French rule in southern Vietnam that year. Red symbolizes the goals of social revolution behind the Vietnamese, national uprising. The star represents the five main classes in Vietnamese societyâ€”intellectuals, farmers, workers, businesspeople and military personnel.

title: fuyutsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Fuyutsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] done [[one side up]] with a [[hachimaki]] and fire control director, and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit, while still based on the original [i]Akizuki-class[/i] template, diverges somewhat from her elder sisters'. It comprises a [[white shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[grey coat]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[grey necktie]], [[black gloves]], [[grey corset]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[grey thighhighs|grey]] checkered [[argyle thighhighs]], and grey [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her gear is mostly identical to the rest of the [i]Akizuki-class[/i] except that the bow part is straight and only the exterior is clad, showing off the interior skeleton. She has her own pair of [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan (fuyutsuki's)|]]. They are missing their flipper arms, are covered in scars and their eyes are closed, only being opened in her damaged CG, where their eyes are shown to be white on black, with a central pupil and glint design.

Her default outfit is the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]]: a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[white shirt]] under a [[purple dress|purple]] [[pleated dress]], [[grey]]/[[purple pantyhose]], and a [[blue bowtie]]. Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She is a very timid and gloomy girl who constantly stutters, speaking each phrase quickly, sparsely and quietly, sometimes even omitting an entire word or phrase.

title: mariachi
body: A traditional Mexican musical genre that dates back to the 18th century, most commonly associated with the city of Guadalajara, which is the state capital of Jalisco and the second largest city of Mexico, best known for its very close association with the charro outfit. Its rise to fame has been attributed to the local mariachi ensemble of TecalitlÃ¡n, a town 100 miles (160 km) away from Guadalajara, which was chosen for the inauguration of the influential president LÃ¡zaro CÃ¡rdenas in 1934. Together with other local cultural elements such as tequila and charrerÃ­a, mariachi is one of the cultural symbols of the city of Guadalajara, which also represents the best known cultural symbols of Mexico.

title: crazybus
body: Bus simulator video game created as a tech demo in 2004 by a Venezuelan developer for the [[Sega Mega Drive]]. The game was soon received an unlicensed and unauthorized release by a 3rd party and became memetically infamous for its lack of quality.

title: sherlock_holmes
body:
Fictional detective created by Scottish author Sir [[Arthur Conan Doyle]]. Commonly portrayed with a [[deerstalker]] hat and curved pipe. Best known for his catchphrase "Elementary". Assisted by Doctor [[John Hamish Watson]] and frequently opposed by the professor [[James Moriarty]]. Solved cases using logical reasoning, disguises and the new field of forensic science.

title: marianne_von_edmund
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Golden Deer.

She has [[blue hair]] typically worn with a [[crown braid]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She is commonly depicted with [[bags under eyes]] and a shadow over her face before the time skip. After the time skip when she is older, these go away.

She has low self-esteem and dislikes talking to people. However, [[hilda_valentine_goneril|Hilda]] is generally depicted as her only friend. She's also fond of animals, in particular horses.

[spoilers]Her low self-esteem is caused by her blood carrying the Crest of the Beast, belonging to a hero who was long lost to history, which promises contempt for those who bear it. It corresponds to the tarot of the Devil, who is also commonly known as "the Beast". She is acutely aware of this and keeps it a secret. As a result, she is deeply religious.[/spoiler]

Remarkably, she ended in the Top 1 of the 2021's edition of "Choose Your Legends":[https://vote5.campaigns.fire-emblem-heroes.com/en-us] (women's side), making her the first non-main character to win the event, alongside the [[Gatekeeper_(fire_emblem)|]].

Voiced by [[Xanthe Huynh]] (English), [[Hata Sawako]] (Japanese).

title: petra_macneary
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] who hails from an archipelago named Brigid. She is the granddaughter of Brigid's king, and is thus a princess, yet she is studious and has a great work ethic. However, she has trouble speaking the language of FÃ³dlan, which is shown in the Japanese version by her speaking in a slow and stilted manner (as if she has trouble finding the words), and in the English version by her using unusual grammar and not using contractions ("I am pleased to be meeting with...no, I am pleased to have met you.").

Has [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]] that grow into [[large breasts]] as she gets older. She also sports a [[facial mark]] under her right eye.

title: dorothea_arnault
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]. Dorothea is a former songstress who is part of the Black Eagles house. She serves as a potent mage and potential love interest of [[Byleth_(fire_emblem)|]], regardless of Byleth's gender. She is also (arguably) the game's best pick for the Dancer class.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]], and a [[curvy]] figure with [[large breasts]], and typically shows off her [[cleavage]].

Not to be confused with [[Dorothy (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]].

title: fallout:_new_vegas
body:
[b][i]Fallout: New Vegas[/i][/b] is a 2010 action role-playing game developed by Obsidian Entertainment and published by Bethesda. It is the fourth major installment of the [[Fallout]] video game series. 

Set in the Mojave Desert 204 years after a devastating nuclear war, the player controls a courier who wakes up after being shot in the head by an unknown assailant. While tracking down their assailant, the courier becomes embroiled in a larger conflict between different governing factions vying for control of the region. 

The game also has four DLC story add-ons, them being Dead Money, Honest Hearts, Old World Blues and Lonesome Road.

title: takanashi_haru_(hypnosis_mic:_rule_the_stage)
body:
A [[Hypnosis Mic: Rule the Stage]] character.

A high school student that operates as the tsukkomi of [[Doutonbori Divers]]. He was originally bullied, but was saved after meeting [[Akanegakubo Ryoutarou|Ryota]] and [[Watamoto Hirotaka|Hirorin]]. They invited him to join their manzai comedy team upon noticing he had a talent for making effortless jabs at their gags.

title: doutonbori_divers
body:
An aspiring manzai comedy trio in [[Hypnosis Mic: Rule the Stage]]. It consists of best friends [[Takanashi Haru (Hypnosis Mic: Rule the Stage)|Takanashi Haru]] (the tsukkomi / straight man), [[Watamoto Hirotaka|Watamoto "Hirorin" Hirotaka]] (the boke / funny man), and [[Akanegakubo Ryoutarou|Akanegakubo "Ryota" Ryoutarou]] (the boke / funny man).

They are all students of [[Tsutsujimori Rosho]].

title: sonic_the_hedgehog_(2006)
body:
[b]Sonic the Hedgehog[/b] (ã‚½ãƒ‹ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ»ã‚¶ãƒ»ãƒ˜ãƒƒã‚¸ãƒ›ãƒƒã‚°) is a [[2006]] platform game made to celebrate the 15th anniversary of the [[Sonic (series)|]] franchise. It was developed by [[Sonic Team]] and published by [[Sega]] for Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3. It introduced the recurring character [[Silver the Hedgehog]]. Due to its lack of distinct title, the game is commonly referred to as [b]Sonic '06[/b] or [b]Sonic 2006[/b]. The game faced development issues which resulted the product being rushed. Upon release, it was widely criticized for its numerous gameplay glitches and long loading times.

h4. External links

title: sonic_the_hedgehog_(ova)
body:
[b]Sonic the Hedgehog[/b] (ã‚½ãƒ‹ãƒƒã‚¯â˜…ã‚¶â˜…ãƒ˜ãƒƒã‚¸ãƒ›ãƒƒã‚°) or [b]Sonic the Hedgehog: The Movie[/b], is a two-episode OVA based on the [[Sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] franchise. Produced by Pierrot, directed by Kazunori Ikegami and written by Masashi Kubota, the OVA was originally released in Japan in 1996, with its two thirty-minute episodes over two separate VHS tapes. 

The two episodes were titled "[b]Welcome to Eggmanland[/b]" (ã‚¨ãƒƒã‚°ãƒãƒ³ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ‰ã¸ã‚€ã‹ãˆ, [i]Eggumanrando e Mukae[/i]) and "[b]Sonic vs. Metal Sonic!![/b]" (ã‚½ãƒ‹ãƒƒã‚¯ï¼¶ï¼³ãƒ¡ã‚¿ãƒ«ãƒ»ã‚½ãƒ‹ãƒƒã‚¯ï¼ï¼).

The anime features [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]], [[Tails (Sonic)|Tails]], [[Knuckles the Echidna|Knuckles]], [[Dr. Eggman]] (Dr. Robotnik in the English release), [[Metal Sonic]] and a few supporting characters created exclusively for the OVA. It also featured an ending theme "Look-a-like", with music score composed by Mitsuhiro Tada, who also did the arrangement for "Look-a-like".

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Sonic the Hedgehog (OVA)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog_(OVA)]
* "Anime News Network: Sonic the Hedgehog":[https://myanimelist.net/anime/2263/Sonic%E2%98%85the%E2%98%85Hedgehog]

title: sonic_adventure_2
body:
[b][i]Sonic Adventure 2[/i][/b] (ã‚½ãƒ‹ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼ 2) is a 3D action platformer game developed by [[Sonic Team]] and published by [[Sega]], released in [[2001]] for the [[sega dreamcast|Sega Dreamcast]] and ported to [[GameCube]] as [b]Sonic Adventure 2: Battle[/b], it was also ported to PC, [[PlayStation 3]], and [[Xbox 360]] as a downloadable title. The story focuses on two dynamics; "[b]Hero[/b]" and "[b]Dark[/b]", with three characters in each, one character from one side playing similar to the other. It ended up being one of the last few games released for the Dreamcast before it's eventual demise.

h4. Characters
h5. Hero Side
* [[Sonic the hedgehog|Sonic the Hedgehog]]
* [[tails (sonic)|Miles "Tails" Prower]]
* [[Knuckles the Echidna]]

h5. Dark Side
* [[Shadow the Hedgehog]]
* [[Dr. Eggman]]
* [[Rouge the Bat]]

title: car_jack
body:
A car jack is a mechanical [[tools|implement]] that placed bottom of a [[car]] or any smaller [[motor vehicle]]s to lift the entire vehicle or whatever sides or corners of the vehicle upward, so that a [[mechanic]] can perform [[repairing|repair]] or maintenance on a section of the vehicle. Theis tag involved any devices/tool used to lifted any motor vehicle especially ones used wheels to move and a [[lever]] to lift the vehicle up, and the solid pyramidal ones

 See [[motor vehicle theft]] for the [[theft]] of a motor vehicle.

h4. See also

* [[creeper (tool)]]

h4. External links

title: sonic_heroes
body:
[b]Sonic Heroes[/b] (ã‚½ãƒ‹ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ’ãƒ¼ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚º) is a [[2003]] 3D [[Sonic (series)|]] game published by [[Sega]] and developed by [[Sonic Team]]. The game released for the [[PlayStation 2]], [[GameCube|Nintendo GameCube]], [[Xbox (original)|]] and Windows PC, being the first to be released on a non-Sega home console. 

In this game, the player takes control of one of four teams, each with three characters who fall into one of three categories; [b]Speed[/b], [b]Fly[/b] and [b]Power[/b], each team has different stage formations, objectives and abilities as well. They need to work in teams to stop Dr. Eggman's new scheme, in a story meant to take place after the events of [[Sonic Adventure 2]].

title: nearly_naked_apron
body:
Like [[naked apron]] but with a [i]slightly[/i] less bare torso, due to the apron being worn in combination with something light and [[revealing clothes|revealing]], usually [[underwear]] or [[swimsuit]]s/[[male swimwear|swimwear]].

If the apron is combined with a significantly more modest outfit, then just use the normal [[apron]] tag. Conversely, if the additional clothing lacks any coverage of the torso or is explicitly allowed by the [[nude]] tag's guidelines ([[tag group:headwear|headwear]], [[tag group:legwear|legwear]] etc.), then the [[naked apron]] tag is still preferred over this one.

title: jade_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the [[Ten Stonehearts]], voiced by [[Mitsuishi Kotono]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a wide-brimmed [[black hat]], visible [[black bra]], [[two-tone dress]] set in [[blue dress|blue]] and [[white dress|white]], [[black jacket]], single [[thigh strap]] to her right leg, jade [[bracelet]] on her right wrist, [[black gloves|black glove]] on her left hand, [[black belt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #7726562: Splash art
* !post #8765002: Yet Hope is Priceless (signature Light Cone)
* !post #7852947: [[Jade (Stoneheart's Oath Ring) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Stoneheart's Oath Ring]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Wealth is the recipe to happiness. Giving it to those who desire happiness is making the best use of it. In this way, my job also brings people happiness. Anyone can receive this blessing... They only have to pay an equivalent price."

A senior manager in the IPC Strategic Investment Department and one of the Ten Stonehearts. Her Cornerstone is "Jade of Credit."
A cold and elegant moneylender, she is skilled at understanding the human heart, with a personal hobby called "Bonajade Exchange."
She's willing to wait patiently for high-value acquisitions and adept at extracting value from seemingly destitute clients.
[/expand]

body:

After her sister [[Mugetsu (touhou)|]] is defeated, Gengetsu rushes to her aid, while admitting that she doesn't even know why the heroine is there. Little is known about either her or her sister and they appear to have no importance to the story. title: horse_girl_(stereotype)
body:
A stereotype/trope of a girl or young woman who passionately loves [[horse]]s. Traditionally this is a shy, more awkward girl who finds control and a sense of freedom in the world of [[horseback riding]], sometimes even taming a wild horse.

This trope tends to go hand in hand with accurate depictions of horse care and equestrian gear, as well as more emotional imagery such as a girl touching foreheads with a horse.

Not to be confused with the more literal type of [[horse girl]].

h4. See also

* [[Cowgirl (Western)]]

title: splatoon_2
body:
Second installment of [[Splatoon (series)|]], released in 2017 for the [[Nintendo Switch]]. Was stylized as "Spla2n" before the official sequel announcement.

The game launched with three gameplay modes, those being [b]Turf War[/b], a multiplayer mode that plays similar to Multiplayer Mode in the first game, [[Salmon Run (splatoon)|]], a multiplayer mode which involves teams of inklings going to a remote island to hunt power eggs, and [b]Hero Mode[/b], a single-player story campaign focusing on the new [[squidbeak splatoon]] member [[Agent 4 (splatoon)|]] as they help [[Marie (splatoon)|]] look for her missing partner, [[Callie (splatoon)|]]. After launch, a fourth mode was added as DLC, [[splatoon 2: octo expansion|Octo Expansion]], a single player mode set after Hero Mode where an amnesiac [[octoling player character|octoling]] sets out to escape an underground facility.

title: maid_for_you_(nikke)
body:
A squad from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

A Tetra Line squad consisting of [[Cocoa (nikke)|]], [[Soda (nikke)|]], and [[Ade (nikke)|]] primarily functioning as maids serving the citizens of the Ark.

[[Privaty (Unkind Maid) (Nikke)|Privaty in her maid alt]] is also a part of this squad, though she is manufactured by Elysion.

While the squad members are named after beverages, it can be interpreted that "Maid for You" is a pun for 'made for you', specifically due to the fact that Nikkes are created to protect and serve humanity against the [[Rapture (nikke)|]]s.

title: gamer_shirts_(meme)
body:
[[Meme]] based around cheesy gaming-related t-shirts commonly sold to young boys. 

There are countless variations, but some of the most common include:

* "I'm close to leveling up and you look like just enough XP"
* "I paused my game for this"
* "Yeah I'm a gamer, deal with it"

Often wraps back around into ironic absurdism.

h4. See also

* [[Oddly specific shirts (meme)|]]

title: imu_(one_piece)
body:
[b]Heavy spoilers for episode 885/chapter 906 and later follow here[/b]:
[spoiler][b]Imu[/b] is the secret occupant of the "'Empty' Throne", making them the highest-ranking member of the World Government above even the Five Elders (a.k.a. [[Gorosei]]). As a result, they are the overarching antagonist of the whole [[One Piece]] series.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Very little else known about them (their sex, species, age, full extent of their powers and abilities, origins, and so on), as their identity were kept secret until the very late stage of the story and they were yet to be fully revealed. However, in their first reveal, they appeared as a [[silhouette]]d [[hood]]ed figure with distinctive [[ringed eyes|ringed]] [[red eyes]] and a very tall [[crown]].[/spoiler]

title: lilith_clawthorne_(harpy)
body:
[[Edalyn Clawthorne]] suffers from a curse that turns her into [[edalyn clawthorne (owl beast)|an uncontrolled bird-beast]]. By confronting this curse within her mind, understanding it, and coming to terms with it, Edalyn was able to control it, gaining a new transformation into a humanoid form while retaining her senses. She named this form "Harpy."

Her sister [[Lilith Clawthorne|Lilith]], who decided to share the curse to reduce its effects, also acquired the ability to control it and, with it, her own harpy form.

title: oceiros_the_consumed_king
body:
An optional boss in [i][[Dark Souls III]][/i].

The former king of Lothric who went mad from isolation as well as a curse which made him resemble [[Seath the Scaleless]].

Father of [[Lothric (younger prince)|]] and [[Lorian (elder prince)|]].

title: scutum
body: The stereotypical [[shield]] of the ancient Roman [[legionnaire|legionary]], tall and usually rectangular, with a distinctive outward vertical curvature. The [i]scutum[/i] appeared among Romans in the fourth century BC, its precise origins unknown, and largely replaced the earlier [i]clipeus[/i], a circular shield adopted from the classical Greeks. Also often sported (in a wildly exaggerated form) by members of the [[Adeptus Astartes]] of [i][[warhammer 40k|Warhammer 40,000]][/i], as part of their general faux-Roman styling.

title: barbie:_fairytopia
body:
An 3D animated movie released in 2005 starring [[Barbie (character)|]]. She portrays the wingless [[fairy]] [[Elina (barbie)|]], who ends up going on a quest to save her world after all the other fairies start falling to a poisonous gas preventing them from flight. At the end of the film, she's rewarded for her bravery with a pair of wings from the Enchantress.

The sequel [[Barbie Fairytopia: Mermaidia]] was released in 2006, and the third movie [b]Barbie Fairytopia: Magic of the Rainbow[/b] was released in 2007.

h4. Characters
* [[Elina (barbie)|]] ([[Barbie (character)|]])
* [[Bibble]]
* [[The Enchantress (barbie)|]]
* Prince Nalu ([[Ken (barbie)|]])

h4. See also

body:

body: A magical girl series started by [[licca-chan (franchise)|a line of toys]], with a 52 episode anime in 1998. title: chelsea_(barbie)
body:
Doll in the [[Barbie (franchise)|]] franchise introduced as one of [[Barbie (character)|]]'s younger sisters in 1995. She's portrayed as a [[child]] of about 7 years old, though she was originally introduced as being a toddler. She was originally marketed as Kelly in the United States and Shelly in the UK, with her name being changed to Chelsea in 2011 so the doll could be marketed under the same name in both markets.

body:

title: my_scene_(franchise)
body:
A line of dolls created by Mattel in 2002, as a response to the [[Bratz]] toyline focusing on a more urban setting. They are considered a spinoff of the [[Barbie (franchise)|]] dolls and were discontinued in the US by 2008 and worldwide by 2011.

[[Barbie (character)|]] herself was a part of the franchise before being replaced by a [[look-alike]] named Kennedy in 2006.

title: sweet_potato
body:
Also called a camote, it is a type of tuber vegetable that isn't as starchy as the [[potato]], but instead has a sweeter taste. Tends to be mislabeled as a yam, but they are from an entirely different botanical species. This is also known as a food that makes you gassy. Hence why you see many artists draw [[fart]] illustrations as part of the gag.

In [[Mexico]], [[Bolivia]], [[Peru]], [[Chile]], Central America, and the [[Philippines]], the sweet potato is known as camote

Popularly associated with [[Aki Minoriko]] because she wears a sweet potato-scented perfume, and has a spellcard named after them in [[Mountain of Faith]].

[[Shiratsuyu_(kancolle)|Shiratsuyu]] and [[Chiyoda_(kancolle)|Chiyoda]] of Kancolle fame is also pretty fond of them.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
* [[roasted sweet potato]]
* [[sweet potato cake]]

title: silent_hill_(movie)
body:
[b]Silent Hill[/b] is a 2006 film adaptation of the video game series [[Silent Hill (series)|]].

The film follows Rose, whose adopted daughter Sharon goes missing in the town of Silent Hill following a car accident. While searching for Sharon, she fights a local cult while uncovering her daughter's connection to the town's past.

The film includes elements from the [[silent hill 1|first]], [[silent hill 2|second]], [[silent hill 3|third]], and [[silent hill 4: the room|fourth]] games in the series.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Silent Hill (film)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silent_Hill_(film)]

title: content_rating
body:
A classification that rates the suitability of content for any type of media. A content rating will forewarn consumers as to any violent, sexual, or objectionable material presented in the show/[[video game cover|game]]/book/etc., as well as suggesting a recommended age level suitable for experiencing this content in a mature manner. Different types of media use different rating standards, although questionable material is widely encouraged to be avoided by young children.

On Danbooru, this commonly refers to explicit [[doujinshi]] that have the R-18+ notice on the [[cover page]], meaning the content is only suitable for people 18 or older. The words "For Adult Only" can also count as a content rating. Another phrase seen on covers is æˆäººæŒ‡å®š ([i]seijin shitei[/i]), which means "Reserved for Adults".

Sometimes, a content rating is also used as an [[euphemism]] in speech and thought bubbles when a character talks or thinks about sex, which is then covered up by a "R-18+" sign as censorship.

h4. See also
* [[CERO]]
* [[ESRB]]
* [[HowTo:Rate]]
* [[Parental Advisory]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Content rating":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Content_rating

title: snow_white_(disney)
body:
Snow White is a fictional character and a main character from [[Disney|Walt Disney Productions]]' first animated feature film [[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (Disney)|]] (1937). The character of [[Snow White (fairy tale character)|]] was derived from a fairy tale known from many countries in Europe with the best-known version being the [[snow white (fairy tale)|1812 tale]] collected by the Brothers Grimm.

h4. See also

* [[Disney]]

title: pinocchio_(disney_movie)
body:
Pinocchio is a 1940 American animated musical fantasy film produced by Walt Disney Productions and released by RKO Radio Pictures. Loosely based on Carlo Collodi's 1883 Italian children's novel [[The Adventures of Pinocchio]], it is the studio's second animated feature film, as well as the third animated film overall produced by an American film studio, after Disney's [[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (Disney)|]] (1937) and Fleischer Studios' Gulliver's Travels (1939). 

h4. Characters

* [[Pinocchio (disney character)|]]
* [[Geppetto (disney)|]]
* [[Jiminy Cricket]]

title: elmer_fudd
body: Elmer J. Fudd is an animated cartoon character in the [[Warner Bros.]] [[Looney Tunes]]/Merrie Melodies series and the archenemy of [[Bugs Bunny]].

title: big_chungus_(meme)
body:
[b]Big Chungus[/b] refers to an image of the obese [[Bugs Bunny]], usually captioned with the phrase "Big Chungus" and presented as a game for [[PlayStation 4]] console. The image originated from the 1941 [[Looney Tunes]] short [i]"Wabbit Twouble"[/i], showing Bugs mocking [[Elmer Fudd]] (who at the time was depicted as obese) by briefly imitating his appearance.

The word "chungus" was coined by [[video game]] journalist Jim Sterling several years before the meme became popular. Starting in July 2019, the [[meme]] regained ironic popularity on iFunny and certain parts of [[Reddit]], particularly as a part of Reddit Moment memes. The meme's popularity has reached the point that [[Warner Bros.]] has inserted some references to Big Chungus into several media, such as in the mobile game Looney Tunes World of Mayhem and the 2021 film [[Space Jam: A New Legacy]].

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Big Chungus":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/big-chungus]

title: speedy_gonzales
body:
A fictional character from the [[Warner Bros.]] [[Looney Tunes]] series of cartoons. Fast-talking and quick-witted, he is known for his speed and agility while speaking with an exaggerated [[Mexico|Mexican]] accent. He is portrayed as a small, anthropomorphic [[mouse (animal)|]] with a large head and ears, and he is typically depicted wearing a yellow [[sombrero]], a [[white shirt]], and [[red pants]]. 

Speedy first appeared in 1953 in the cartoon "Cat-Tails for Two," and has since appeared in numerous other cartoons. He is often portrayed as a heroic character who outsmarts his enemies, including his arch-nemesis Sylvester the Cat. Speedy is also known for his catchphrase "Â¡Ãndale! Â¡Ãndale! Â¡Arriba! Â¡Arriba!" which roughly translates to "Hurry up! Hurry up! Upward! Upward!" in English.

He is a very popular character in Mexico and Latin America.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Looney Tunes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Looney_Tunes]
* "Wikipedia: Speedy Gonzales":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speedy_Gonzales]

title: bugs_bunny
body:
One of the main characters of [[Looney Tunes]] series, later became the de-facto mascot of [[Warner Bros.]]

Bugs is a blue-grey [[personification|anthromorphic]] [[rabbit]] with a sharp and quick-witted personality. Most of the time, Bugs often involved in a feud with the hunter [[Elmer Fudd]] and will usually and comically outsmart him.

He is the originator of the, now near universal, misconception that rabbits like to eat [[carrot]]s.

h4. See also
